guides.title: 10 best ways to fix a slow Mac OS and make it fast, even faster
guides.raw_content:
# 10 best ways to fix a slow Mac OS and make it fast, even faster

## 1. Step 1
- 1) RAM - Check the memory size of your Random-Access-memory. If not suitable then kindly upgrade it to experience fast execution of applications and programs. Upgrading the RAM to a higher memory size will make a huge difference in experiencing a [http://www.stellarinfo.com/mac-software/speed-up-mac.php|faster Mac]. This will even make your old Mac perform much better.
![Step 1 Image 164341](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/iMWLQkJGYhmUnIxd.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/iMWLQkJGYhmUnIxd.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/iMWLQkJGYhmUnIxd.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/iMWLQkJGYhmUnIxd.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/iMWLQkJGYhmUnIxd.full -->

## 2. Step 2
- 2) Login Items – Login items are irritating if irrelevant to your purpose. Also, they consume some space on Mac OS X hard disk drive during start up and often causes system to freeze for a while. Isn't wise to switch them the login items at start-up. To do so make visit to System Preferences > Accounts > Login Items, and unchecked irrelevant login items that you may not want to see at the start-up of your Mac.
![Step 2 Image 164344](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/bMOqBKB6qdO3B3UC.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/bMOqBKB6qdO3B3UC.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/bMOqBKB6qdO3B3UC.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/bMOqBKB6qdO3B3UC.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/bMOqBKB6qdO3B3UC.full -->

## 3. Step 3
- 3) Clean Desktop – A cleaner desktop also contributes to make your Mac faster. Make your desktop look tidy not untidy. Properly choose the files which you want to save on the desktop. Don't make it look like a mess.
![Step 3 Image 164342](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/HwcUgFRsImLjoMsm.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/HwcUgFRsImLjoMsm.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/HwcUgFRsImLjoMsm.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/HwcUgFRsImLjoMsm.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/HwcUgFRsImLjoMsm.full -->

## 4. Step 4
- 4) Trash-Bin Folder – You must often have heard your mother stressing upon you to dump of the room garbage. Apply the same with Mac trash bin, make your habit to visit the trash bin folder and after considering the files and folders don't forget to empty the trash. Doing so surely creates some free space for Mac OS hard disk drive.
![Step 4 Image 164345](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/qj232dLgjWLjND2A.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/qj232dLgjWLjND2A.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/qj232dLgjWLjND2A.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/qj232dLgjWLjND2A.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/qj232dLgjWLjND2A.full -->

## 5. Step 5
- 5) Trim your Applications – There might be plenty of applications and software that interests you but on the other hand there may few or more applications which are completely unwanted. So, why not uninstall the unwanted applications from your Mac and let contribute some more free space. Same goes with the widgets, uninstall any unwanted widget that might be consuming some space of the Mac disk drive.
![Step 5 Image 164393](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/oJGJulsPENHDaMtF.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/oJGJulsPENHDaMtF.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/oJGJulsPENHDaMtF.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/oJGJulsPENHDaMtF.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/oJGJulsPENHDaMtF.full -->

## 6. Step 6
- 6) Language Packs – At the time of installation if a software, many languages other than your default language gets installed on the main hard disk drive. These languages are of no use and thus occupy unnecessary space on Mac HDD. But removing the unwanted languages might take a lot of your time and effort if you go manually. Instead use a third party clean up Mac tool to accomplish this task. Tools like these, would clear all the unnecessary language packs from the system leaving your default language intact.
![Step 6 Image 164346](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/JODWPyNrFr2wsLom.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/JODWPyNrFr2wsLom.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/JODWPyNrFr2wsLom.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/JODWPyNrFr2wsLom.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/JODWPyNrFr2wsLom.full -->

## 7. Step 7
- 7) Switch off applications which are not used – Several apps on Mac are not being used by all the users. For instance, Universal Access, Blue-tooth, Speech Recognition are some of those apps that might not be a part of user's daily activity. So why not switch them off.
![Step 7 Image 164347](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/X1bsJSdpKYAkYoRF.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/X1bsJSdpKYAkYoRF.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/X1bsJSdpKYAkYoRF.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/X1bsJSdpKYAkYoRF.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/X1bsJSdpKYAkYoRF.full -->

## 8. Step 8
- 8) Files and folders management - De-Clutter the Mac HDD by launching an effective files and folders management. Mac's behaviour to read the size of the folder before it begins any execution, so try to keep less number of files under a single folder. Organize the files and folders to create good amount of free space for the boot drive.
![Step 8 Image 164348](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/xiYIKeaJCEl1QUNg.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/xiYIKeaJCEl1QUNg.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/xiYIKeaJCEl1QUNg.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/xiYIKeaJCEl1QUNg.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/xiYIKeaJCEl1QUNg.full -->

## 9. Step 9
- 9) Temporary files – Each day an application or a software is used, large number of temporary files gets created and are stored upon the hard disk drive. To clear files like user, and font caches use atsutil command line program
![Step 9 Image 164349](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/QBBlMjBUTMZkT1HF.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/QBBlMjBUTMZkT1HF.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/QBBlMjBUTMZkT1HF.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/QBBlMjBUTMZkT1HF.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/QBBlMjBUTMZkT1HF.full -->

## 10. Step 10
- 10) Defrag HDD – With the help of a third party defrag utility you can can reduce or even eliminate the fragmentations present on your Mac HDD. The fragmented hard disk drive causes the OS to read and write the hard disk in a slower fashion. When the disk is defragged, the different parts of files into a single chunk of sequential memory locations.
- The above activity though simple needs to be monitored with proper timing and effort. Mac users often look for a clean up Mac OSX utility that can do the job for them. [http://www.stellarinfo.com/mac-software/speed-up-mac.php|Give a try to Stellar Speed up Mac utility to make your Mac go fast, even faster.]
![Step 10 Image 164350](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/cQIvpLnytRd611DP.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/cQIvpLnytRd611DP.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/cQIvpLnytRd611DP.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/cQIvpLnytRd611DP.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/cQIvpLnytRd611DP.full -->

## Conclusion

To reassemble your device, follow these instructions in reverse order.

guides.title: How to verify and repair Mac OS X Disk Permissions
guides.raw_content:
# How to verify and repair Mac OS X Disk Permissions

If your mac is having trouble recognizing a replacement battery or other components, you may need to repair your main disk permissions. Follow this guide as a first step in troubleshooting.

## 1. Step 1
- You will want to first open Disk Utilities, which can be found in the Applications folder under Utilities
  - Or you can take the shortcut and use Spotlight!
![Step 1 Image 169035](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/hRAi2WN6LPyEmIOJ.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/hRAi2WN6LPyEmIOJ.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/hRAi2WN6LPyEmIOJ.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/hRAi2WN6LPyEmIOJ.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/hRAi2WN6LPyEmIOJ.full -->
![Step 1 Image 169036](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/KuSXyhBWaggyLJBZ.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/KuSXyhBWaggyLJBZ.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/KuSXyhBWaggyLJBZ.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/KuSXyhBWaggyLJBZ.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/KuSXyhBWaggyLJBZ.full -->

## 2. Step 2
- Once opened, you should be presented with a window that looks like this.
  - You will want to select the name of your Mac OS X Startup disk in the left column.
- After clicking on the name of your Hard drive, you will be presented with a few different options at the top.
  - The First Aid heading is what you will want to be under.
- Click on the Verify Disk Permissions, starting the process.
![Step 2 Image 169038](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/JlYkMS4CdXADlwoT.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/JlYkMS4CdXADlwoT.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/JlYkMS4CdXADlwoT.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/JlYkMS4CdXADlwoT.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/JlYkMS4CdXADlwoT.full -->
![Step 2 Image 169045](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/cfSVrLNIcn1fF1LY.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/cfSVrLNIcn1fF1LY.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/cfSVrLNIcn1fF1LY.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/cfSVrLNIcn1fF1LY.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/cfSVrLNIcn1fF1LY.full -->

## 3. Step 3
- This usually will take anywhere from 3 minutes to 15 minutes.  The best thing to do is to wait.
- As time progresses, you will see information pop up in the window highlighted.
  - This is good, it means that it is seeing the problems that may be keeping your computer from running well.
![Step 3 Image 169044](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/GtLRse1SqfGNB2L1.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/GtLRse1SqfGNB2L1.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/GtLRse1SqfGNB2L1.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/GtLRse1SqfGNB2L1.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/GtLRse1SqfGNB2L1.full -->
![Step 3 Image 169047](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/jWQxx3ULtaB6hCYF.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/jWQxx3ULtaB6hCYF.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/jWQxx3ULtaB6hCYF.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/jWQxx3ULtaB6hCYF.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/jWQxx3ULtaB6hCYF.full -->

## 4. Step 4
- After verifying the disk permissions, go ahead and select repair disk permissions to start that process.
- During that time, which again should take anywhere from 3-10 minutes, feel free to get up, walk around for a few minutes, or go pet a cat.
![Step 4 Image 169048](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/DfcKyFPLkJtD4m46.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/DfcKyFPLkJtD4m46.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/DfcKyFPLkJtD4m46.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/DfcKyFPLkJtD4m46.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/DfcKyFPLkJtD4m46.full -->
![Step 4 Image 169049](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/2WsKUPmVAQPyx3RG.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/2WsKUPmVAQPyx3RG.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/2WsKUPmVAQPyx3RG.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/2WsKUPmVAQPyx3RG.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/2WsKUPmVAQPyx3RG.full -->

## Conclusion

Congrats!  You successfully repaired your disk permissions!

guides.title: Making Visible the Users Library Directory in OS X Lion
guides.raw_content:
# Making Visible the Users Library Directory in OS X Lion

## 1. Step 1
- Many Macintosh users were excited when OS X 10.7 (Lion) was released, but after using it for a short time, many users realized that something was missing from lion.
- The users Library directory is not where it it should be, infact, it is nowhere to be found. Fortunately, it is very simple to bring back the disappearing Library.
![Step 1 Image 174501](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/mDwCh5J5dmBYVICI.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/mDwCh5J5dmBYVICI.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/mDwCh5J5dmBYVICI.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/mDwCh5J5dmBYVICI.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/mDwCh5J5dmBYVICI.full -->
![Step 1 Image 174502](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/uTtuPmfnOMTJMspW.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/uTtuPmfnOMTJMspW.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/uTtuPmfnOMTJMspW.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/uTtuPmfnOMTJMspW.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/uTtuPmfnOMTJMspW.full -->

## 2. Step 2
- To begin the process, you will need to go to your Applications folder, which can be found in your Finder side bar.
- Once in the Applications folder, you will want to find the Utilities folder.
![Step 2 Image 174514](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/SJnEMiv6CjtbAeAx.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/SJnEMiv6CjtbAeAx.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/SJnEMiv6CjtbAeAx.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/SJnEMiv6CjtbAeAx.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/SJnEMiv6CjtbAeAx.full -->

## 3. Step 3
- After navigating to the Utilities folder you will need to scroll down to find the Terminal application.
![Step 3 Image 174515](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/GOBY1CmZlGPUUJIS.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/GOBY1CmZlGPUUJIS.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/GOBY1CmZlGPUUJIS.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/GOBY1CmZlGPUUJIS.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/GOBY1CmZlGPUUJIS.full -->

## 4. Step 4
- Once you have opened Terminal, you will need to type ''chflags nohidden ~/Library/'' and then press ''Enter''.
- This will immediately make your Library folder visible under your user.
![Step 4 Image 174516](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/LOABu6BoCEBjFbwg.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/LOABu6BoCEBjFbwg.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/LOABu6BoCEBjFbwg.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/LOABu6BoCEBjFbwg.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/LOABu6BoCEBjFbwg.full -->
![Step 4 Image 174517](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/CJHQWf5ds15XAKrU.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/CJHQWf5ds15XAKrU.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/CJHQWf5ds15XAKrU.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/CJHQWf5ds15XAKrU.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/CJHQWf5ds15XAKrU.full -->

## 5. Step 5
- Once you have finished with Terminal, type ''exit'' to end your terminal processes. After you have typed this and hit enter you may quit out of Terminal.
![Step 5 Image 174518](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/5PMDZiHYw3IWmE43.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/5PMDZiHYw3IWmE43.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/5PMDZiHYw3IWmE43.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/5PMDZiHYw3IWmE43.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/5PMDZiHYw3IWmE43.full -->

## 6. Step 6
- To hide the Library folder, simply type ''chflags hidden ~/Library'' and press ''Enter''.
> ⚠️ **Caution:** Remember to type ''exit'' and press ''Enter'' before quitting Terminal.
![Step 6 Image 174519](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/IsLYAiDD1SBfYKrw.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/IsLYAiDD1SBfYKrw.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/IsLYAiDD1SBfYKrw.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/IsLYAiDD1SBfYKrw.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/IsLYAiDD1SBfYKrw.full -->

## Conclusion

To reassemble your device, follow these instructions in reverse order.

guides.title: How to Restore or Apply an Oleophobic Coating
guides.raw_content:
# How to Restore or Apply an Oleophobic Coating

Use this guide along with an oleophobic coating kit to restore the oleophobic coating on your device, or to add an oleophobic coating to your screen or screen protector. These kits can also be used to treat other glass surfaces, such as eye glasses, watches, smartwatches, and more.

''The coating requires 8-12 hours to set, so it’s best to perform this procedure before bedtime.''

=== What is an oleophobic coating? ===
Modern smartphones feature an oleophobic (oil-repellent) coating that protects the screen, improves smoothness, and reduces fingerprints. This coating consists of a thin layer of [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lipophobicity|fluoropolymer-based solids] (similar to Teflon) that is bonded to the glass.

Over time and use, this coating will wear off, and you may notice parts of the screen getting greasy or dirty with fingerprints more easily.

## 1. Clean the surface
- Use isopropyl alcohol to thoroughly clean the surface you are planning to apply the coating to.
- Wipe the screen dry with a clean [product|IF145-284|microfiber cloth].
![Step 1 Image 2040777](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ItHIwZjhaADtFJKo.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ItHIwZjhaADtFJKo.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ItHIwZjhaADtFJKo.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ItHIwZjhaADtFJKo.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ItHIwZjhaADtFJKo.full -->
![Step 1 Image 2040778](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/bYCNWxfEoawyOHKo.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/bYCNWxfEoawyOHKo.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/bYCNWxfEoawyOHKo.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/bYCNWxfEoawyOHKo.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/bYCNWxfEoawyOHKo.full -->

## 2. Prepare a wiping finger
> **Note:** '''Read the next three steps before you attempt the procedure.''' The oleophobic coating's liquid solvent evaporates very quickly when applied, so you'll need to work quickly.
- Wrap one finger in a bit of plastic. You can use a sandwich bag or some plastic wrap.
> **Note:** You will use this covered finger to rub the coating liquid onto the screen. This will prevent your finger from absorbing the liquid.
![Step 2 Image 2040779](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/uaAalLbUEoQlJMw1.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/uaAalLbUEoQlJMw1.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/uaAalLbUEoQlJMw1.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/uaAalLbUEoQlJMw1.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/uaAalLbUEoQlJMw1.full -->
![Step 2 Image 2040780](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/CG5RgUNNBHqcyqKP.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/CG5RgUNNBHqcyqKP.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/CG5RgUNNBHqcyqKP.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/CG5RgUNNBHqcyqKP.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/CG5RgUNNBHqcyqKP.full -->
![Step 2 Image 2040781](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/bLkbHHdX1umHkQCi.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/bLkbHHdX1umHkQCi.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/bLkbHHdX1umHkQCi.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/bLkbHHdX1umHkQCi.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/bLkbHHdX1umHkQCi.full -->

## 3. Apply the coating to the surface
- Apply 10-15 drops of the oleophobic coating liquid onto the surface.
> **Note:** If you are coating a large surface such as a large phone or tablet, apply ten drops to a portion of the screen, and work on one portion at a time.
![Step 3 Image 2040782](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/Pf5phNaVc3GuIroT.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/Pf5phNaVc3GuIroT.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/Pf5phNaVc3GuIroT.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/Pf5phNaVc3GuIroT.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/Pf5phNaVc3GuIroT.full -->
![Step 3 Image 2040776](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/1U6DPkuJKPx1QLMI.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/1U6DPkuJKPx1QLMI.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/1U6DPkuJKPx1QLMI.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/1U6DPkuJKPx1QLMI.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/1U6DPkuJKPx1QLMI.full -->
![Step 3 Image 2040784](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/6BQ5lrnyKOWJBtyt.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/6BQ5lrnyKOWJBtyt.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/6BQ5lrnyKOWJBtyt.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/6BQ5lrnyKOWJBtyt.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/6BQ5lrnyKOWJBtyt.full -->

## 4. Distribute the coating
- Wipe your plastic-covered finger over the surface with quick, light swipes until the liquid evaporates.
> **Note:** You don't need to rub very hard—you're just spreading out the coating molecules onto the surface before the solvent evaporates.
- If you applied the liquid to only a portion of the surface, repeat the liquid application and rubbing procedure to the remaining surface.
![Step 4 Image 2040785](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ZgvxGjTvReJjEZL3.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ZgvxGjTvReJjEZL3.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ZgvxGjTvReJjEZL3.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ZgvxGjTvReJjEZL3.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ZgvxGjTvReJjEZL3.full -->
![Step 4 Image 2040786](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/vK5gEOl2UMxrKSGP.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/vK5gEOl2UMxrKSGP.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/vK5gEOl2UMxrKSGP.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/vK5gEOl2UMxrKSGP.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/vK5gEOl2UMxrKSGP.full -->
![Step 4 Image 2040787](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ZHOT2jcrYeRLjs14.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ZHOT2jcrYeRLjs14.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ZHOT2jcrYeRLjs14.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ZHOT2jcrYeRLjs14.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ZHOT2jcrYeRLjs14.full -->

## 5. Give the coating time to set
> ⚠️ **Caution:** Do not touch the surface for 8-12 hours in order to allow the coating to bond to the surface.
> **Note:** For best results, apply the coating before bedtime, so it has all night to bond.
- Afterward, you can wipe off any residue remaining on the touch screen with a clean microfiber cloth.
- Repeat this process 2-3 times to fully maximize the oleophobic coating performance and film durability.
![Step 5 Image 2040788](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/OkJmnSk5dWWwhaMk.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/OkJmnSk5dWWwhaMk.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/OkJmnSk5dWWwhaMk.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/OkJmnSk5dWWwhaMk.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/OkJmnSk5dWWwhaMk.full -->

## Conclusion

Done properly, this results in a perfect oleophobic coating on your device.

Your device will still collect some fingerprints, but the oil left behind by your fingers will be greatly reduced, and easier to wipe off.

Reapply the coating every 1-2 months or as needed.

guides.title: Wire Stripping
guides.raw_content:
# Wire Stripping

Wire needs to be exposed from its insulation in order before it can be soldered to another wire. Wire stripping exposes the wire so you are able to make good connections.

## 1. Step 1
- Match your gauge of wire to the gauge on a wire stripper.
> **Note:** Some wire strippers will have two gauge sizes for the same hole, one for solid wire and one for stranded. Make sure you use the right one for the wire you are stripping!
![Step 1 Image 203582](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/OWvSuS3SbA6VUdji.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/OWvSuS3SbA6VUdji.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/OWvSuS3SbA6VUdji.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/OWvSuS3SbA6VUdji.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/OWvSuS3SbA6VUdji.full -->

## 2. Step 2
- Place the wire stripper about a 1/4” from the end of the wire and squeeze down.
> **Note:** You can strip more than 1/4" at a time, but the effort becomes harder. About 1/2-5/8" (13-16 mm) is the most you should probably attempt.
![Step 2 Image 203581](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/UxCKbDnTHmIhDgld.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/UxCKbDnTHmIhDgld.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/UxCKbDnTHmIhDgld.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/UxCKbDnTHmIhDgld.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/UxCKbDnTHmIhDgld.full -->

## 3. Step 3
- While squeezing, pull the stripper toward the end of the wire. This should expose some of the wire by removing its insulation.
![Step 3 Image 203583](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/iWYfbFf3XMeQ4YIr.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/iWYfbFf3XMeQ4YIr.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/iWYfbFf3XMeQ4YIr.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/iWYfbFf3XMeQ4YIr.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/iWYfbFf3XMeQ4YIr.full -->

## Conclusion

After your wire has been stripped, the exposed wire is ready to be soldered and reconnected to other parts of the microphone.

guides.title: Convert PDF to JPEG, BMP, PNG and TIFF file formats
guides.raw_content:
# Convert PDF to JPEG, BMP, PNG and TIFF file formats

While thinking of converting pdf file to image format on a Mac system, you lacks the support of an efficient software tool for such requirements. We have underwent this situation several times where we utmost require the help of a converter utility which can easily convert the pages of a large PDF file into popular image formats such as JPEG and BMP. Obviously, with proper resources in hand one can easily end up preparing the most professional and attractive PPT for any core group meeting. Today with the help of such utility, I'll share the steps on how to convert a PDF to image format.

## 1. Step 1
- Download Stellar Phoenix PDF to Image Converter Mac, install & launch the app. http://www.stellarinfo.com/mac-software/convert-pdf-to-image-for-mac.php
![Step 1 Image 214822](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/lxUpVi13yOLr4ZvR.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/lxUpVi13yOLr4ZvR.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/lxUpVi13yOLr4ZvR.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/lxUpVi13yOLr4ZvR.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/lxUpVi13yOLr4ZvR.full -->

## 2. Step 2
- Click the option ''''Select File'''' to load a desired PDF file for conversion. Alternatively, if you have forgotten the exact path of the PDF file saved on Mac, then the tool provides an option ''''Find Files'''', which in turn will look for the PDF files in particular volume.
![Step 2 Image 214819](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/26Q3TllhHRqnJJtv.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/26Q3TllhHRqnJJtv.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/26Q3TllhHRqnJJtv.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/26Q3TllhHRqnJJtv.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/26Q3TllhHRqnJJtv.full -->

## 3. Step 3
- Once all the PDF files are uploaded on the software menu, choose the desired output images format. The PDF selected can be converted into '''JPEG, BMP, PNG and TIFF '''formats. These are wholly accepted images file formats and can be used in any project, presentation etc. All set! Proceed by clicking the ''''CONVERT'''' button.
![Step 3 Image 214820](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/HqFHGURXaPDoAUCG.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/HqFHGURXaPDoAUCG.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/HqFHGURXaPDoAUCG.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/HqFHGURXaPDoAUCG.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/HqFHGURXaPDoAUCG.full -->

## 4. Step 4
- The conversion process may takes some time, typically in minutes depending on the PDF size, no. of pages to be converted etc. After the process finishes, PDF pages converted into image files are arranged on the left pane of the software interface. Use check box to select, de-select images to save on the hard drive.
![Step 4 Image 214821](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/G2QDvt4ZUigcKsPE.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/G2QDvt4ZUigcKsPE.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/G2QDvt4ZUigcKsPE.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/G2QDvt4ZUigcKsPE.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/G2QDvt4ZUigcKsPE.full -->

## Conclusion

To reassemble your device, follow these instructions in reverse order.

guides.title: MacBook Pro 13" Software: Safe Simple Customizing Replacement
guides.raw_content:
# MacBook Pro 13" Software: Safe Simple Customizing Replacement

Where to go to locate image files responsible for Mission control and dashboard backgrounds. Then I will show you HOW TO SAFELY AND PROPERLY CHANGE THEM!

## 1. Step 1
- As Always: Be Careful. The Files around what you are working with ARE VITAL TO YOU Operating SYSTEM and IT's UI!
![Step 1 Image 221824](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/3QlJrmoetbSDVEDp.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/3QlJrmoetbSDVEDp.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/3QlJrmoetbSDVEDp.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/3QlJrmoetbSDVEDp.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/3QlJrmoetbSDVEDp.full -->
![Step 1 Image 221825](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/CZKqIMTOXMbpnSkS.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/CZKqIMTOXMbpnSkS.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/CZKqIMTOXMbpnSkS.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/CZKqIMTOXMbpnSkS.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/CZKqIMTOXMbpnSkS.full -->

## 2. Step 2
- Open up Finder.
- Navigate to your System Hard Drive               (ie: Mine is "Macintosh HD")
- Open  "SYSTEM"
- Open "LIBRARY"
- Open "CORE SERVICES"
- NOW BE CAREFUL Some of these Apps are important! Find the app "DOCK.APP" open the menu (right click/two finger click) and click "SHOW PACKAGE CONTENTS"
- Open "CONTENTS"
- AGAIN BE CAREFUL HERE!!!                             Open "RESOURCES"

## 3. Step 3
- The Files within this folder are very important for part of your Mac's GUI; So Only mess with the following files mentioned!
  - "PIRELLI.png" & PIRELLI@2...    These files are responsible for you dashboard background and Mission Control Tab for Dashboard(if enabled)
  - There is a set Tiling mode in the OS so selecting an image of proper size is crucial.
  - Create a new folder called "pirelliORIGINAL" and place these two AND ONLY TWO files here
  - Next Take your desired Image and rename it to "pirelli.png"
  - Dimensions: I Use 2880 x1900
  - And as shown move the image to the RESOURCES FOLDER
![Step 3 Image 221836](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/dQUgABrH1Ox2FJnV.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/dQUgABrH1Ox2FJnV.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/dQUgABrH1Ox2FJnV.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/dQUgABrH1Ox2FJnV.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/dQUgABrH1Ox2FJnV.full -->

## 4. Step 4
- Now for Mission Control:
- Same steps as before instead find the files labeled "defaultdesktop.png" & " defaultdesktop@2x.png"
- put in a new folder labeled "defaultdesktopORIGINAL"
- Chose Your Image (Make sure it is a Higher Resolution Image) and rename it to defaultdesktop.png
- Again Drag the new image to this folder ("RESOURCES")
- So the files are moved and in place, now to activate it...
![Step 4 Image 221844](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/2ULVSOy6cveygaDY.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/2ULVSOy6cveygaDY.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/2ULVSOy6cveygaDY.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/2ULVSOy6cveygaDY.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/2ULVSOy6cveygaDY.full -->
![Step 4 Image 221842](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/sGBFHYlOWDjR6BkW.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/sGBFHYlOWDjR6BkW.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/sGBFHYlOWDjR6BkW.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/sGBFHYlOWDjR6BkW.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/sGBFHYlOWDjR6BkW.full -->

## 5. Step 5
- open up your terminal
- type the following EXACTLY (case-sensitive)      '''killall Dock'''  [press enter]
- *You may need to have super user permissions for the step above. If so, add the word "sudo" before the command above. (So the whole command will read '''sudo killall Dock''')
- 'YOU SHOULD NOW SEE YOUR NEW BACKDROPS!""
![Step 5 Image 221849](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/aWqrPBpbQaQvelwv.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/aWqrPBpbQaQvelwv.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/aWqrPBpbQaQvelwv.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/aWqrPBpbQaQvelwv.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/aWqrPBpbQaQvelwv.full -->

## Conclusion

To reassemble your device, follow these instructions in reverse order.

guides.title: Adding images to a new question
guides.raw_content:
# Adding images to a new question

It seems that some of us are having trouble with adding images to questions. Images, in addition to a good description of the problem, are most helpful.

***An updated version is available! [guide|21499]***

***NOTE: iFixit requires you to crop or resize images if they're not captured in 4:3 format. Most modern cameras capture in 3:2 or 16:9, which will require a crop. If you change your capturing preferences when taking pictures to 4:3 you shouldn't need to crop them in the Media Manager.***

## 1. Step 1
- The first thing to do, is to click on the top right orange button "Ask a Question"
- This action is going to open the question window. Here is where the device that the question pertain to is being entered, a short question, as well as the description of the problem.
- Most devices are listed on a pick list, but can be entered by free-text as well.
- The description of the problem should include what attempts to solve the problem have been undertaken.
![Step 1 Image 227348](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ntER1TMXn3O3dTvX.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ntER1TMXn3O3dTvX.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ntER1TMXn3O3dTvX.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ntER1TMXn3O3dTvX.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ntER1TMXn3O3dTvX.full -->
![Step 1 Image 227349](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/xNrnxf3FQpwNvtMi.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/xNrnxf3FQpwNvtMi.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/xNrnxf3FQpwNvtMi.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/xNrnxf3FQpwNvtMi.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/xNrnxf3FQpwNvtMi.full -->
![Step 1 Image 227351](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/NYJ4LMShnJ6L6eZn.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/NYJ4LMShnJ6L6eZn.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/NYJ4LMShnJ6L6eZn.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/NYJ4LMShnJ6L6eZn.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/NYJ4LMShnJ6L6eZn.full -->

## 2. Step 2
- Once the text has been filled out and images are to be placed with the question, click on the orange "Image" tab on the bottom left hand corner.
- This opens an approximately quarter screen size window with an upload symbol. This particular window may be empty, or it may have multiple images already present. This depends on if one has previously posted images. This is where the images are stored until they are going to be posted.
- To open the import image dialog, click the "Upload Icon", this will open up a upload dialog window. From here images can be either placed into the question, by "drag&drop", only if they are already in the image repository. Most of the time it will require using the "Browse Files" icon. .
  - When it is clicked on, it will access the users computer and list the directories
![Step 2 Image 227369](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/COZFoMFrdbjgNQJW.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/COZFoMFrdbjgNQJW.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/COZFoMFrdbjgNQJW.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/COZFoMFrdbjgNQJW.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/COZFoMFrdbjgNQJW.full -->
![Step 2 Image 227370](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/atHm1TsFFhCiDBMb.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/atHm1TsFFhCiDBMb.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/atHm1TsFFhCiDBMb.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/atHm1TsFFhCiDBMb.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/atHm1TsFFhCiDBMb.full -->
![Step 2 Image 227372](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/11iGoGvp5yYVVs1O.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/11iGoGvp5yYVVs1O.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/11iGoGvp5yYVVs1O.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/11iGoGvp5yYVVs1O.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/11iGoGvp5yYVVs1O.full -->

## 3. Step 3
- Choose the directory that contains the image to be imported. It is possible to select multiple images at once. Hold the "Ctrl" key down and left click on individual image files allow for this.
- Once the file(s) is selected, click the "open" key. This will now upload the file to the image repository. Once the file(s) is uploaded, it will show in the repository.
- With the file showing in the bottom window, left '''click and hold''' on the image. Then drag the image into the question text window. This action will be noticeable since the background of the question text window changes. Release the left mouse button once the cursor is in the question text window.
  - The image will be placed at the last cursor position. Ensure that the cursor is, where the image is supposed to be placed, before dragging it into the question text box.
![Step 3 Image 227377](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/y3DFLMHWNBYSRMTT.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/y3DFLMHWNBYSRMTT.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/y3DFLMHWNBYSRMTT.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/y3DFLMHWNBYSRMTT.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/y3DFLMHWNBYSRMTT.full -->
![Step 3 Image 227379](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/3YwWUByLENTE1VWu.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/3YwWUByLENTE1VWu.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/3YwWUByLENTE1VWu.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/3YwWUByLENTE1VWu.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/3YwWUByLENTE1VWu.full -->
![Step 3 Image 227381](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/jfN253Npu6oUnEwD.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/jfN253Npu6oUnEwD.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/jfN253Npu6oUnEwD.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/jfN253Npu6oUnEwD.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/jfN253Npu6oUnEwD.full -->

## 4. Step 4
- Once the image was dragged to the question, it will show up as a number in the text box, but can be viewed in the preview. The image will now have been removed out of the repository as well.
  - Close the upload image window by clicking on the orange "Image" tab. If the position of the image, as well as the description of the problem is satisfactory, click the orange "Ask it" tab. This will post the question with the image.
![Step 4 Image 227383](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/yIU1mGwO1V3dhjDN.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/yIU1mGwO1V3dhjDN.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/yIU1mGwO1V3dhjDN.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/yIU1mGwO1V3dhjDN.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/yIU1mGwO1V3dhjDN.full -->

## Conclusion

Hope this helps, good luck.

guides.title: Adding images to an existing answer
guides.raw_content:
# Adding images to an existing answer

Sometimes we forget to post images with our answers, or we want to add images later because we got more information. This will show how to add those images. The procedure is the same to add images to existing questions.

A [guide|21499|newer version of this guide exists here].

## 1. Step 1
- To get into the Edit window, click the "Edit" link
- The edit window is now open. Click on the orange "Images" tab in the bottom left corner
- This opens an approximately quarter screen size window with am upload symbol. This particular window may be empty, or it may have multiple images already present. This depends on if one has previously posted images. This is where the images are stored until they are going to be posted.
![Step 1 Image 227446](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/2jOYOLDBunvEsAMU.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/2jOYOLDBunvEsAMU.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/2jOYOLDBunvEsAMU.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/2jOYOLDBunvEsAMU.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/2jOYOLDBunvEsAMU.full -->
![Step 1 Image 227447](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/NRYk2xFPkbiZdRVY.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/NRYk2xFPkbiZdRVY.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/NRYk2xFPkbiZdRVY.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/NRYk2xFPkbiZdRVY.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/NRYk2xFPkbiZdRVY.full -->
![Step 1 Image 227448](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/F6Z4FvJwKTiucYIS.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/F6Z4FvJwKTiucYIS.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/F6Z4FvJwKTiucYIS.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/F6Z4FvJwKTiucYIS.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/F6Z4FvJwKTiucYIS.full -->

## 2. Step 2
- To open the import image dialog, click the "Upload Icon", this will open up a upload dialog window. From here images can be either placed into the question, by "drag&drop", only if they are already in the image repository. Most of the time it will require using the "Browse Files" icon. .
- When it is clicked on, it will access the users computer and list the directories. Choose the directory that contains the image to be imported. It is possible to select multiple images at once. Hold the "Ctrl" key down and left click on individual image files allow for this.
- Once the file(s) is selected, click the "open" key. This will now upload the file to the image repository. Once the file(s) is uploaded, it will show in the repository.
![Step 2 Image 227451](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/KW5lpZjcWrowqxGL.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/KW5lpZjcWrowqxGL.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/KW5lpZjcWrowqxGL.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/KW5lpZjcWrowqxGL.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/KW5lpZjcWrowqxGL.full -->
![Step 2 Image 227452](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/1tYokSnLRKy1NRvy.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/1tYokSnLRKy1NRvy.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/1tYokSnLRKy1NRvy.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/1tYokSnLRKy1NRvy.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/1tYokSnLRKy1NRvy.full -->
![Step 2 Image 227453](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/FCBoiLkSi1dZeMwp.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/FCBoiLkSi1dZeMwp.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/FCBoiLkSi1dZeMwp.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/FCBoiLkSi1dZeMwp.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/FCBoiLkSi1dZeMwp.full -->

## 3. Step 3
- With the file showing in the bottom window, left click and hold on the image. Then drag the image into the question text window. This action will be noticeable since the background of the edit text window changes. Release the left mouse button once the cursor is in the question text window.
> ⚠️ **Caution:** The image will be placed at the last cursor position. Ensure that the cursor is, where the image is supposed to be placed, before dragging it into the question text box.
- Once the image is dragged to the question, it will show up as a number in the edit text box, but can be viewed in the preview. The image will now have been removed out of the repository as well.
- Close the upload image window by clicking on the orange "Image" tab. If the position of the image, as well as the rest of the edit is satisfactory, click the orange "Submit revision" tab. This will post the edited answer with the image.
![Step 3 Image 227454](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/qZ13jcU6jYSZJ2Mi.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/qZ13jcU6jYSZJ2Mi.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/qZ13jcU6jYSZJ2Mi.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/qZ13jcU6jYSZJ2Mi.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/qZ13jcU6jYSZJ2Mi.full -->
![Step 3 Image 227455](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/wJMFKH652ZPGWeAN.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/wJMFKH652ZPGWeAN.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/wJMFKH652ZPGWeAN.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/wJMFKH652ZPGWeAN.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/wJMFKH652ZPGWeAN.full -->
![Step 3 Image 227456](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/WAaTsew5U2OOiS4m.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/WAaTsew5U2OOiS4m.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/WAaTsew5U2OOiS4m.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/WAaTsew5U2OOiS4m.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/WAaTsew5U2OOiS4m.full -->

## Conclusion

Hope this helps, good luck

guides.title: How to Remove a Stripped Screw
guides.raw_content:
# How to Remove a Stripped Screw

Stripped screws are a nightmare for any repair enthusiast. Try as you might, some screws just do not want to come out. Frustration takes over and before you know it, that once "+" shape has turned into a "O". Never fear; we've got your back. This guide will walk you through how to use a rotary tool to remove a stripped screw by cutting a small slit in the screw head, allowing you to remove the screw with a flathead screwdriver.

Techniques:

# [guide|13213|Different Screwdriver|stepid=45159]
# [guide|13213|Rubber Band|stepid=98920]
# [guide|13213|Screw Extracting Pliers|stepid=98921]
# [guide|13213|Superglue|stepid=98935]
# [guide|13213|Rotary Tool|stepid=45160]
***Always wear safety goggles when using a rotary tool to prevent injury from debris or sparks.***

[video|https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SEZyUzt8xys]

## 1. Use a different screwdriver
- Your screw is stripped, and your screwdriver is no longer sufficient. Before busting out the heavy hitters, try the following:
  - Use different screwdrivers. First try slightly smaller or larger head sizes, then a flat head screwdriver, to see if you can get it to catch on some part of the stripped screw.
> ⚠️ **Caution:** If the bit doesn't catch the screw instantly, do not continue. Otherwise, you run the risk of further stripping the screw.
- If either of these techniques are fruitful, congrats! Your screw is free.
![Step 1 Image 590387](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/V6MTNFApWDrKHgNg.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/V6MTNFApWDrKHgNg.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/V6MTNFApWDrKHgNg.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/V6MTNFApWDrKHgNg.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/V6MTNFApWDrKHgNg.full -->

## 2. Use a rubber band
> **Note:** A rubber band can give you the extra grip you need.
- Stretch a rubber band over the stripped screw.
> **Note:** You can also use a thin piece of fabric.
- Insert a properly-sized screwdriver, and give it a turn.
![Step 2 Image 590455](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/oFtcMtdYHt1vjLou.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/oFtcMtdYHt1vjLou.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/oFtcMtdYHt1vjLou.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/oFtcMtdYHt1vjLou.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/oFtcMtdYHt1vjLou.full -->
![Step 2 Image 590456](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/FaeEb6oX1RQRbpjR.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/FaeEb6oX1RQRbpjR.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/FaeEb6oX1RQRbpjR.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/FaeEb6oX1RQRbpjR.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/FaeEb6oX1RQRbpjR.full -->
![Step 2 Image 590454](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/PjgUmyMDCfyMWYBy.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/PjgUmyMDCfyMWYBy.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/PjgUmyMDCfyMWYBy.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/PjgUmyMDCfyMWYBy.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/PjgUmyMDCfyMWYBy.full -->

## 3. Use a pair of pliers
- If the screw head is accessible, try a pair of [product|IF145-127|screw extracting pliers]. If you can get a good grip, turn the pliers and the screw should turn along with it!
- Once the screw is loosened a bit, you can probably back it out the rest of the way using a screwdriver.
![Step 3 Image 590458](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/MwGbj4fiN6k62vcQ.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/MwGbj4fiN6k62vcQ.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/MwGbj4fiN6k62vcQ.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/MwGbj4fiN6k62vcQ.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/MwGbj4fiN6k62vcQ.full -->
![Step 3 Image 590457](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/wsvJRMkHTiXA6Gs2.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/wsvJRMkHTiXA6Gs2.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/wsvJRMkHTiXA6Gs2.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/wsvJRMkHTiXA6Gs2.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/wsvJRMkHTiXA6Gs2.full -->

## 4. Use glue
- Still stuck? Try adding a dab of superglue to the top of the screw.
- Set your driver into the screw head, and allow the glue to dry.
- Using a firm grip and downward pressure, give the driver a twist to remove the screw.
> **Note:** Don't forget to clean the remains of the glue from the tip of your driver.
![Step 4 Image 590761](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/TLRvyaXx1o2XtAA5.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/TLRvyaXx1o2XtAA5.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/TLRvyaXx1o2XtAA5.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/TLRvyaXx1o2XtAA5.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/TLRvyaXx1o2XtAA5.full -->
![Step 4 Image 590762](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/p1aFCPYmJKvNUMWF.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/p1aFCPYmJKvNUMWF.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/p1aFCPYmJKvNUMWF.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/p1aFCPYmJKvNUMWF.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/p1aFCPYmJKvNUMWF.full -->
![Step 4 Image 590763](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/BuAB56HRAXZPPsIa.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/BuAB56HRAXZPPsIa.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/BuAB56HRAXZPPsIa.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/BuAB56HRAXZPPsIa.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/BuAB56HRAXZPPsIa.full -->

## 5. Use a rotary tool
> **Note:** If you were unable to remove the screw with screwdrivers, pliers, a rubber band, or super glue, then a rotary tool should do the trick.
- Attach a thin cutting disk to your rotary tool. Before you cut anything, make sure the disk is secured well.
> ⚠️ **Caution:** Make sure you wear protective goggles anytime you use a rotary tool to prevent injuries from flying debris and sparks.
![Step 5 Image 590388](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/Tef1h3PCbFZfHnvJ.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/Tef1h3PCbFZfHnvJ.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/Tef1h3PCbFZfHnvJ.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/Tef1h3PCbFZfHnvJ.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/Tef1h3PCbFZfHnvJ.full -->

## 6. Step 6
> **Note:** In this step, you will use the rotary tool to make a thin cut in the stripped screw that enables you to use a flathead screwdriver to remove the screw.
> **Note:** We recommend using a low power setting (we used 2 out of 6) to prevent damaging the rest of the device or the screw.
> **Note:** You want the cut to be deep enough that you can fit a flathead screwdriver into it, but thin enough that the screwdriver has something to grip.
- Make a single thin cut into the head of the stripped screw.
![Step 6 Image 590391](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/JbdZJyNZgtsAFyq4.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/JbdZJyNZgtsAFyq4.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/JbdZJyNZgtsAFyq4.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/JbdZJyNZgtsAFyq4.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/JbdZJyNZgtsAFyq4.full -->
![Step 6 Image 590389](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/mOpMJcaWsVS6qQk2.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/mOpMJcaWsVS6qQk2.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/mOpMJcaWsVS6qQk2.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/mOpMJcaWsVS6qQk2.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/mOpMJcaWsVS6qQk2.full -->

## 7. Step 7
- Use a flathead screwdriver to remove the screw from the device.
  - The size of the driver will depend on the size of the screw, but use the largest size that will fit in your cut.
> **Note:** If you cannot fit a screwdriver into the cut, use the rotary tool to make the cut larger. Make only small cuts; if you cut off too much of the screw, a screwdriver will not catch and you will not be able to twist the screw.
> ⚠️ **Caution:** Wear eye protection and give your device a few good blasts of compressed air before reassembling it. The rotary tool can scatter loose metal shavings around the device, creating the potential for an electrical short if not blown clear.
![Step 7 Image 590390](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/VbU2XLEhZQ5qcRDW.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/VbU2XLEhZQ5qcRDW.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/VbU2XLEhZQ5qcRDW.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/VbU2XLEhZQ5qcRDW.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/VbU2XLEhZQ5qcRDW.full -->

## Conclusion

Check out the video in the intro for some additional tips on dealing with stripped screws. Always use a high-quality screwdriver. Low-quality screwdriver material will cause damage to screws.

guides.title: Orange Teardown
guides.raw_content:
# Orange Teardown

We've been accused of favoring one fruit over all the rest. Some have even claimed that we love one juicy snack more than [guide|811|others|new_window=true].

No more. To show some appreciation towards other members of the fruit family, we decided to test out the accessibility, repairability, and end-of-life design of the Orange.

Tried the teardown at home with mild to moderate success?  Celebrate with an '''[product|IF145-223|Orange Teardown t-shirt]'''! Or if you're having technical difficulties with your Orange, make sure you've [[Orange Identification Guide|identified your Orange]] correctly, and then visit our [[Orange Troubleshooting|Orange Troubleshooting Guide]] to figure out what's going on. Perhaps you just need the [product|IF145-221|right tool] for the job.

Want to know more about how we juiced this Orange? Read the full behind-the-scenes account on the '''[http://ifixit.org/4445/orange-teardown-behind-the-peel/|iFixit blog|new_window=true]'''.

Check out all the latest fruits of our labor by following [link|http://www.twitter.com/ifixit|iFixit] on Twitter or "Liking" us on [link|http://www.facebook.com/iFixit|Facebook].

## 1. Step 1
- The Orange. Nature's mysterious orange sphere. Believed to be the hybrid between a pomelo and a mandarin, the Orange is a staple food that has been cultivated since ancient times.
- So what components make up this juicy device? Here are the tech specs:
  - Orange peel
  - Orange seeds
  - Orange pith
  - Orange pulp
  - Orange juice
  - Orange color (corresponding to a 620 nm wavelength)
![Step 1 Image 233720](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/6Iy6KWux6MZxdaFv.full)

## 2. Step 2
- Before we could start penetrating the thick outer peel protecting the Orange's sweet innards, this [http://www.penny-arcade.com/comic/2010/10/11|small|new_window=true] [http://www.penny-arcade.com/comic/2003/6/4/|mechanoid|new_window=true] appeared out of thin air. Cue [http://www.youtube.com/watch?feature=player_detailpage&v=unZjBx5X0hA#t=24s|Final Fantasy battle theme|new_window=true].
- After a protracted tussle, the Orange emerged victorious. The fate of the mechanoid is unknown—it vanished mysteriously into the arcane shadows from whence it came.
- Strike a pose; Juxtapose. We set up our customary comparison shot to contrast the Orange to an [http://guide-images.ifixit.net/igi/T13ywXMbsLFkZmta.large|Apple|new_window=true].
![Step 2 Image 233087](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/IP3xhJyBLLupZEiI.full)

## 3. Step 3
- What exactly adheres the outer layer to the Orange? We aren't really sure. We're familiar with how much adhesive [guide|8277|devices these days|stepid=33139|new_window=true] employ and are prepared to act accordingly.
- In any case, the only sure-fire way to know is to heat the Orange up with our [product|IF145-031|heat gun|new_window=true]. This has never been done in the history of Orange disassembly. This truly is one small step for an Orange, one giant leap for fruitkind.
> ⚠️ **Caution:** Do not attempt this procedure at home. We are Orange-certified repair technicians.
![Step 3 Image 233091](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ByA3xqQMLRXiOqUu.full)

## 4. Step 4
- At this point, we are fairly confident that the heat gun sufficiently loosened any adhesive in the Orange. Time to get to the tearing down!
- To our surprise, our [http://xkcd.com/55/|normal approach|new_window=true] does not seem to apply to this strange device.

## 5. Step 5
- Oddly, we have no luck with a [product|IF145-123|guitar pick|new_window=true], [product|IF145-000|plastic opening tool|new_window=true], [product|IF145-185|tech knife|new_window=true], [product|IF145-108|ruler|new_window=true], [product|IF145-020|pair of tweezers|new_window=true], or even an [product|IF145-130|iSesamo|new_window=true]!
> **Note:** Perhaps we've found some untapped functionality as a tool holder. This may warrant further investigation.
![Step 5 Image 233092](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/yOgGW3qdDYlYSQ6x.full)

## 6. Step 6
- Having no luck with our vast array of poking, prodding, and prying tools, we figure a little more heat might be necessary.
> ⚠️ **Caution:** Turns out keeping a heat gun on the same spot for too long will damage the outer layer of the peel beyond repair. If you're not extremely cautious, you will find yourself in need of a new outer peel.
> **Note:** We stood in line at the local [http://goo.gl/maps/SqRV2|Orange Store|new_window=true] for hours to get a whole heap of Oranges, so hopefully we'll have a fool-proof method to open them by the time we start writing repair guides.

## 7. Step 7
- With no other option in sight, we turn to our last resort for impossible-to-open devices: the [product|IF145-096|Pentalobe screwdriver|new_window=true].
- [http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0070996/|Phooey|new_window=true]! That didn't seem to work, either. We are running out of ideas…
![Step 7 Image 233102](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/2iObT6q64e3426mf.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/2iObT6q64e3426mf.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/2iObT6q64e3426mf.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/2iObT6q64e3426mf.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/2iObT6q64e3426mf.full -->

## 8. Step 8
- Just when we think all hope is lost, [http://guide-images.ifixit.net/igi/DMGsUtdxyEAYcRuc|a tool descends upon us from the repair heavens|new_window=true] as Morgan Freeman's voice booms throughout our teardown room.
  - ''Behold! [product|IF145-221|The oOpener!]''
- A tool rumored to open any orange in the universe, we had only heard about the oOpener in old repair myths shared around [http://guide-images.ifixit.net/igi/QV4kKa1S4FYqvTPE|company campfires].
- While most disassembly tools, such as the [product|IF145-198|iOpener], can be fabricated, the oOpener is said to only be available to those who are [http://guide-images.ifixit.net/igi/UMyJTVjPNTMOyTyT|pure of heart, mind, and vision of a repair-friendly world|new_window=true].

- We quickly get to work slicing through the Orange's thick peel with the oOpener, spiraling down like whirlybirds in the breeze.
- Having the right tool for the job is a truly heartwarming experience. We hold back the overflow of nostalgia as the oOpener brings back fond memories of [http://guide-images.ifixit.net/igi/NlAqo5mVAYyuXPVc.large|early spudger escapades|new_window=true].

## 10. Step 10
- A plastic opening tool allows us to finish the job started with the armor-piercing strength of the oOpener.
- Prying things open with a plastic opening tool—finally [http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_kQBVneC30o|a familiar tune|new_window=true] for us.

- It took us ten steps, but we finally managed to penetrate the impenetrable.
- As an added bonus, the Orange comes with a free accessory, the Orange Peel—an amusing, Slinky-like contraption, guaranteed to deliver hours of fun.

## 12. Step 12
- ''Results may vary. Your Orange Peel may not actually look like a Slinky. Do not try to use Peel as a Slinky. Do not try to use Peel as any form of toy. Do not give Peel to children. Consult a doctor if you feel that your Orange Peel is not Slinky-y enough. ''

## 13. Step 13
- Now that we've removed the rind, let's take a brief scientific look at the make-up of the Orange in the first ever segment of '''Fruit Science with iFixit!'''
- Oranges and other citrus fruits are of the order Hesperidium—a kind of berry with a tough, leathery rind.
- The three important layers of such fruits are the exocarp (rind), mesocarp (pith), and endocarp (the delicious edible part).
![Step 13 Image 233216](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/vJXFt4AmBSViTwLI.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/vJXFt4AmBSViTwLI.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/vJXFt4AmBSViTwLI.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/vJXFt4AmBSViTwLI.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/vJXFt4AmBSViTwLI.full -->
![Step 13 Image 233201](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/pDGdFTuwdEbBLB5r.full)

## 14. Step 14
- One final obstacle stands between us and sectioning the Orange into its component wedges.
- Gentle prying with a plastic opening tool separates the navel, freeing up the top of the Orange for separation.
- This appears to be yet another irreversible step; the Orange's repairability score will likely take another hit.
![Step 14 Image 233123](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/uATHAk2lZJYsLvRL.full)

- We notice the resistance of some natural adhesive as we slowly pull the Orange apart.
- It appears that if you are not careful enough whilst pulling the Orange apart, you will tear the sectional membranes of the Orange.

## 16. Step 16
- We love modular devices, and this one is as modular as they come. Having modular components makes replacing each component a lot ~~tastier~~ easier.
- All ten major internal components of this device are easily removable. However, we are worried that they might not go back together as easily as they come apart, a common problem in fruit repair.
- Though the Orange's repairability is highly questionable, we do admire its end-of-life design. It is completely recyclable, compostable, and delicious-able. We hope that devices like this will some day [http://youtu.be/ZN5PoW7_kdA?t=4s|catch the attention|new_window=true] of other device manufacturers and help keep electronics out of landfills…unless they are compostable, of course!

## 17. Step 17
- Sectioning the left half reveals another component: the central column of the Orange.
> **Note:** The central column is a structural build-up of pith, the mesocarp layer of the Orange's body.
- Turning a wedge over reveals more of the pithy mesocarp. Its utility is currently unknown; we suspect possibly EMI shielding?

<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/igQCTaQi4oPFkUtJ.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/igQCTaQi4oPFkUtJ.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/igQCTaQi4oPFkUtJ.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/igQCTaQi4oPFkUtJ.full -->
![Step 17 Image 233133](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/P6cBHvxueY5JqTfP.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/P6cBHvxueY5JqTfP.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/P6cBHvxueY5JqTfP.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/P6cBHvxueY5JqTfP.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/P6cBHvxueY5JqTfP.full -->

## 18. Step 18
- It's time to unlock the deeper mysteries of the Orange.
- Unlike some of our [guide|10528|more complicated teardowns|new_window=true], a steady hand and a [product|IF145-185|sharp blade|new_window=true] are the only tools we need to get a view of a section's internal structure.
> ⚠️ **Caution:** This may puncture the Orange's interior cells, causing acidic adhesive leakage. In the event of contact with this fluid, wash hands and eyes immediately…or just lick your fingers.
![Step 18 Image 233135](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/SCQj6jiP2OKtGqTo.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/SCQj6jiP2OKtGqTo.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/SCQj6jiP2OKtGqTo.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/SCQj6jiP2OKtGqTo.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/SCQj6jiP2OKtGqTo.full -->
![Step 18 Image 233136](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/sVrZTo4IXhYUDKIW.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/sVrZTo4IXhYUDKIW.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/sVrZTo4IXhYUDKIW.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/sVrZTo4IXhYUDKIW.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/sVrZTo4IXhYUDKIW.full -->

## 19. Step 19
- With the wedge split, we get a serious look at the Orange's seriously small seeds.
- These [http://guide-images.ifixit.net/igi/YVvgJCHiCsOuQtGl|extremely small components|new_window=true] seem to be nested deep within the device. Repairability will definitely take a hit for this one.
- [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Orange_(fruit)#Navel_oranges|Navel] Oranges, such as this, have small, sterile seeds that cannot be used to reproduce more Oranges—a cutting from an existing fruit-bearing tree must be grafted to another tree.
> **Note:** This is the most advanced anti-piracy DRM measure we've seen, definitively ensuring that Orange owners won't be able to produce copies of their Orange to share with their friends.
  - We assume the device is supported by [http://www.orange.com/en/home|Orange Mobile]  but it remains to be seen if it will be released to [http://cdn.c.photoshelter.com/img-get/I0000eG2kHZXxbxI/s/750/750/CARRYING-ORANGES.jpg|other carriers] in the future.
![Step 19 Image 233203](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/RvQKZogjXLsXlM1P.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/RvQKZogjXLsXlM1P.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/RvQKZogjXLsXlM1P.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/RvQKZogjXLsXlM1P.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/RvQKZogjXLsXlM1P.full -->
![Step 19 Image 233194](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/YICZOcSOoATOncsN.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/YICZOcSOoATOncsN.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/YICZOcSOoATOncsN.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/YICZOcSOoATOncsN.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/YICZOcSOoATOncsN.full -->

## 20. Step 20
- Orange Repairability Score: '''O out of 10''' (10 is easiest to repair).
- Normal operation requires breaking the outer case.
- Partition membranes and linings are exceedingly fragile, and will break during casual use.
- Impossible to reassemble after opening.
- All components secured with some sort of natural adhesive.
- Internal components filled with acid.
![Step 20 Image 272180](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/BCtBhD1TikuMFKYN.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/BCtBhD1TikuMFKYN.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/BCtBhD1TikuMFKYN.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/BCtBhD1TikuMFKYN.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/BCtBhD1TikuMFKYN.full -->
![Step 20 Image 233218](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/o5IQuxSoKZvwqlbV.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/o5IQuxSoKZvwqlbV.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/o5IQuxSoKZvwqlbV.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/o5IQuxSoKZvwqlbV.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/o5IQuxSoKZvwqlbV.full -->

guides.title: Removing Stripped Counter-Sunk Allen-Key Bolts
guides.raw_content:
# Removing Stripped Counter-Sunk Allen-Key Bolts

A flat sunk bolt with an Allan head was torn out, the hex key had no grip and the sunk bolt could not be grasped with pliers. It was a fat bolt so drilling out would have been very difficult.

## 1. Step 1
- Cut a slot into the screw head.
- Place a screwdriver in the slot and tap with a hammer in the counter-clockwise sense to loosen the bolt.
- Unscrew the bolt with the driver.
![Step 1 Image 265108](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/yfPWkPQhMAtVc2Ii.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/yfPWkPQhMAtVc2Ii.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/yfPWkPQhMAtVc2Ii.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/yfPWkPQhMAtVc2Ii.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/yfPWkPQhMAtVc2Ii.full -->

guides.title: Prep Black Wire
guides.raw_content:
# Prep Black Wire

How to prep a black wire for XYZ job.

## 1. Step 1
- Locate QCPN#10669 which is a black hookup wire.
![Step 1 Image 270991](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/QlXNwHFWXMIxX1jE.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/QlXNwHFWXMIxX1jE.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/QlXNwHFWXMIxX1jE.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/QlXNwHFWXMIxX1jE.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/QlXNwHFWXMIxX1jE.full -->

## 2. Step 2
- Measure out a 10cm length of wire.
- Use a pair of flash cutters to carefully cut through the wire.
> ⚠️ **Caution:** Caution: the wire must be no longer than 10.5cm and no shorter than 9.5cm in length.
![Step 2 Image 270993](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/JiInjIXcDayloHmG.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/JiInjIXcDayloHmG.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/JiInjIXcDayloHmG.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/JiInjIXcDayloHmG.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/JiInjIXcDayloHmG.full -->
![Step 2 Image 270992](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/fMjIKUoBMOC5ZHnM.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/fMjIKUoBMOC5ZHnM.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/fMjIKUoBMOC5ZHnM.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/fMjIKUoBMOC5ZHnM.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/fMjIKUoBMOC5ZHnM.full -->
![Step 2 Image 270997](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/YIPGxMgQRT2FXbLr.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/YIPGxMgQRT2FXbLr.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/YIPGxMgQRT2FXbLr.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/YIPGxMgQRT2FXbLr.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/YIPGxMgQRT2FXbLr.full -->

## 3. Step 3
- Your wire should look like this now. #testedit
![Step 3 Image 270999](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/HLcFCTHykVE41CMP.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/HLcFCTHykVE41CMP.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/HLcFCTHykVE41CMP.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/HLcFCTHykVE41CMP.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/HLcFCTHykVE41CMP.full -->

## 4. Step 4
- Measure 20mm from either end of the wire.
- With the flash cutters remove the instulation that is covering the wire.
> ⚠️ **Caution:** Be careful not to cut to deep because you will damage the wire strands inside.
![Step 4 Image 271004](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/tb5oZncjPMOyxDuQ.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/tb5oZncjPMOyxDuQ.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/tb5oZncjPMOyxDuQ.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/tb5oZncjPMOyxDuQ.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/tb5oZncjPMOyxDuQ.full -->
![Step 4 Image 271005](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/VrfSXAshhqIh2IaJ.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/VrfSXAshhqIh2IaJ.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/VrfSXAshhqIh2IaJ.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/VrfSXAshhqIh2IaJ.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/VrfSXAshhqIh2IaJ.full -->

## 5. Step 5
> **Note:** Measure 10mm from the other side of the wire.
- Remove the insulation from the wire with a pair of flash cutters.
![Step 5 Image 271002](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/QV2cxRTBJWTOTCri.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/QV2cxRTBJWTOTCri.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/QV2cxRTBJWTOTCri.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/QV2cxRTBJWTOTCri.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/QV2cxRTBJWTOTCri.full -->
![Step 5 Image 271013](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/sgiMfwaVddZhCPqZ.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/sgiMfwaVddZhCPqZ.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/sgiMfwaVddZhCPqZ.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/sgiMfwaVddZhCPqZ.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/sgiMfwaVddZhCPqZ.full -->

## 6. Step 6
- Your finished wire should now look like this.
- Remember to twist of the ends of the wire with your fingers so that the wire strands are not loose.
![Step 6 Image 271008](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/VXNgG1luIKUEuRXr.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/VXNgG1luIKUEuRXr.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/VXNgG1luIKUEuRXr.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/VXNgG1luIKUEuRXr.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/VXNgG1luIKUEuRXr.full -->

## Conclusion

You are finished.
