guides.title: How to Clone an Existing Drive
guides.raw_content:
# How to Clone an Existing Drive

This guide will go through the process of cloning your existing software, OS, and data to a new hard drive.

(SuperDuper is now compatible with Big Sur & Monterey.)

***NOTE:*** With the introduction of macOS Catalina, certain steps in this guide are out of date.

***''IMPORTANT: Cloning the hard drive is not recommended''*** ''if you have a Mac that uses a  recovery partition (MacOS 10.7 - present) or internet recovery (2011 - present). Instead, to move your data to a new drive, first [guide|119046|create a backup of your existing drive|new_window=true]. Then, either use [guide|119499|internet recovery|new_window=true] or [guide|66371|create a bootable external drive|new_window=true] so you’ll be ready to install macOS onto your new drive and migrate your data afterward.''

If you are happy with your existing operating system installation and would simply like to upgrade your hard drive capacity, you can clone your existing hard drive to your new drive.

To clone a hard drive, you will need a way to connect the second hard drive to your Mac. Our [product|IF107-152|2.5" Hard Drive Enclosure|new_window=true] or one of our [product|IF107-143-2|Hard Drive Upgrade Kits|new_window=true] works great for cloning your drive over.

To clone your hard drive, we recommend a program called [link|http://www.shirt-pocket.com/SuperDuper/SuperDuperDescription.html|SuperDuper!], by Shirt Pocket Software.

The following instructions assume that you’ll be using SuperDuper! and the 2.5" hard drive enclosure to clone onto a new 2.5" drive. If you are using a different setup, your installation process may be somewhat different.

## 1. Install the drive into the enclosure
> **Note:** Before you begin, look at your hard drive's ports and make sure that it has the right connectors:
  - Narrow data port
  - Wide power port
![Step 1 Image 2081985](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/4JhGoJe32DvBABcV.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/4JhGoJe32DvBABcV.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/4JhGoJe32DvBABcV.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/4JhGoJe32DvBABcV.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/4JhGoJe32DvBABcV.full -->

## 2. Open the enclosure
- Use the included screwdriver to remove the two Phillips screws.
![Step 2 Image 2082016](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/l5LZ15iFvLKSgKkj.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/l5LZ15iFvLKSgKkj.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/l5LZ15iFvLKSgKkj.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/l5LZ15iFvLKSgKkj.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/l5LZ15iFvLKSgKkj.full -->

## 3. Step 3
- Slide the plastic tray out of the aluminum housing.
![Step 3 Image 2082011](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/GlKNvlSsO66fTYOs.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/GlKNvlSsO66fTYOs.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/GlKNvlSsO66fTYOs.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/GlKNvlSsO66fTYOs.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/GlKNvlSsO66fTYOs.full -->
![Step 3 Image 2082007](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/uFfdj1OJMECyOWK1.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/uFfdj1OJMECyOWK1.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/uFfdj1OJMECyOWK1.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/uFfdj1OJMECyOWK1.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/uFfdj1OJMECyOWK1.full -->

## 4. Install the SSD
- Set the drive in the plastic tray and align the drive ports with the tray socket.
> **Note:** To prevent strain on the enclosure socket, lay the drive as flat against the tray as possible.
- Carefully push the drive into the tray socket to seat the ports.
- Press the drive's raised edge down into the plastic tray.
> **Note:** If the drive edge catches on the foam block, the drive is not fully seated against the tray socket. Continue pressing the drive into the socket until it clears the foam block.
![Step 4 Image 2082006](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/HEDUVFyoyHCPjZQG.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/HEDUVFyoyHCPjZQG.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/HEDUVFyoyHCPjZQG.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/HEDUVFyoyHCPjZQG.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/HEDUVFyoyHCPjZQG.full -->
![Step 4 Image 2082008](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/yG2mwjvGE4BUJmEU.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/yG2mwjvGE4BUJmEU.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/yG2mwjvGE4BUJmEU.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/yG2mwjvGE4BUJmEU.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/yG2mwjvGE4BUJmEU.full -->
![Step 4 Image 2082014](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/bHqdPvQVNkFSCtrl.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/bHqdPvQVNkFSCtrl.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/bHqdPvQVNkFSCtrl.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/bHqdPvQVNkFSCtrl.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/bHqdPvQVNkFSCtrl.full -->

## 5. Step 5
- Flip the drive tray over.
- Use the a Phillips screwdriver to install the four mounting screws (included in the kit) to secure the drive to the tray.
![Step 5 Image 2082025](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/tZZJY1ygca2RoloP.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/tZZJY1ygca2RoloP.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/tZZJY1ygca2RoloP.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/tZZJY1ygca2RoloP.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/tZZJY1ygca2RoloP.full -->

## 6. Step 6
- Slide the tray back into the aluminum housing.
- Reinstall the two Phillips screws to secure the tray.
![Step 6 Image 2082010](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/oUPQLXfcPRKeDdLN.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/oUPQLXfcPRKeDdLN.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/oUPQLXfcPRKeDdLN.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/oUPQLXfcPRKeDdLN.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/oUPQLXfcPRKeDdLN.full -->
![Step 6 Image 2082012](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ajPNox2oOMWeTPlM.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ajPNox2oOMWeTPlM.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ajPNox2oOMWeTPlM.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ajPNox2oOMWeTPlM.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ajPNox2oOMWeTPlM.full -->
![Step 6 Image 2082017](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/v5h44HwBXbMnMlGu.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/v5h44HwBXbMnMlGu.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/v5h44HwBXbMnMlGu.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/v5h44HwBXbMnMlGu.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/v5h44HwBXbMnMlGu.full -->

## 7. Step 7
- Power on your Mac and wait for it to fully load.
- Plug the enclosure into your Mac's USB port.
![Step 7 Image 1466381](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ETaIXnVj1XIav6Rj.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ETaIXnVj1XIav6Rj.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ETaIXnVj1XIav6Rj.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ETaIXnVj1XIav6Rj.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ETaIXnVj1XIav6Rj.full -->
![Step 7 Image 1466279](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/3Hd6qNGIMlmPHJor.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/3Hd6qNGIMlmPHJor.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/3Hd6qNGIMlmPHJor.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/3Hd6qNGIMlmPHJor.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/3Hd6qNGIMlmPHJor.full -->

## 8. Step 8
- Under the '''Go''' pulldown menu, select '''Utilities'''.
- Open '''Disk Utility''' from the '''Utilities''' window.
![Step 8 Image 1466280](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ZjehMOUv23StrdTT.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ZjehMOUv23StrdTT.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ZjehMOUv23StrdTT.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ZjehMOUv23StrdTT.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ZjehMOUv23StrdTT.full -->
![Step 8 Image 1466281](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/3TNSTJGi2aLFw6QX.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/3TNSTJGi2aLFw6QX.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/3TNSTJGi2aLFw6QX.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/3TNSTJGi2aLFw6QX.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/3TNSTJGi2aLFw6QX.full -->

## 9. Step 9
- Select your new hard drive from the left column in Disk Utility.
> **Note:** If the new drive is not showing up, disconnect the enclosure and check if the hard drive is properly connected to the enclosure.
  - Select the '''Erase''' option near the top row of buttons.
  - Select a name for your new drive, and select '''"APFS"''' for the format.
> ⚠️ **Caution:** '''Warning:''' Pressing the erase button will erase the entire contents of the drive. Make sure you have selected the new hard drive!
- Press the '''erase''' button.
> **Note:** This process may take up to 10 minutes, so be patient.
- Quit Disk Utility once the erase is complete.
![Step 9 Image 1466282](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/xQdoZda4WOoqk26b.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/xQdoZda4WOoqk26b.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/xQdoZda4WOoqk26b.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/xQdoZda4WOoqk26b.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/xQdoZda4WOoqk26b.full -->
![Step 9 Image 1466283](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/FaNEFOFrdxRqjQFw.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/FaNEFOFrdxRqjQFw.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/FaNEFOFrdxRqjQFw.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/FaNEFOFrdxRqjQFw.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/FaNEFOFrdxRqjQFw.full -->
![Step 9 Image 1466284](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/cOQMivI1Li3QcAu5.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/cOQMivI1Li3QcAu5.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/cOQMivI1Li3QcAu5.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/cOQMivI1Li3QcAu5.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/cOQMivI1Li3QcAu5.full -->

## 10. Step 10
- Download and install [http://www.shirt-pocket.com/SuperDuper/SuperDuperDescription.html|SuperDuper!|new_window=true]
- Under the '''Go''' pulldown menu, select '''Applications'''.
- Open '''SuperDuper!'''
![Step 10 Image 1466285](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/SGh5RRwEmAtDC3bK.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/SGh5RRwEmAtDC3bK.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/SGh5RRwEmAtDC3bK.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/SGh5RRwEmAtDC3bK.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/SGh5RRwEmAtDC3bK.full -->
![Step 10 Image 1466286](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/MuUfnPfUqo1gA4Hp.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/MuUfnPfUqo1gA4Hp.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/MuUfnPfUqo1gA4Hp.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/MuUfnPfUqo1gA4Hp.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/MuUfnPfUqo1gA4Hp.full -->

## 11. Step 11
- In the copy pulldown menu, select your current drive.
- In the destination pulldown menu, select the new drive.
- In the method pulldown menu, select '''"Backup—all files"'''.
![Step 11 Image 1466287](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/WXfpN3atGlxKACEs.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/WXfpN3atGlxKACEs.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/WXfpN3atGlxKACEs.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/WXfpN3atGlxKACEs.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/WXfpN3atGlxKACEs.full -->

## 12. Step 12
- Press the '''"Copy Now"''' button.
- If prompted, provide your password.
- Click '''"Copy"''' when warned about erasing the drive.
![Step 12 Image 1466288](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/iF3jZbh4hALxiFlx.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/iF3jZbh4hALxiFlx.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/iF3jZbh4hALxiFlx.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/iF3jZbh4hALxiFlx.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/iF3jZbh4hALxiFlx.full -->
![Step 12 Image 1466289](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/RGZ5K41IlmC1hopg.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/RGZ5K41IlmC1hopg.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/RGZ5K41IlmC1hopg.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/RGZ5K41IlmC1hopg.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/RGZ5K41IlmC1hopg.full -->
![Step 12 Image 1466290](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/fRXFr5krMix3aQtG.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/fRXFr5krMix3aQtG.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/fRXFr5krMix3aQtG.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/fRXFr5krMix3aQtG.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/fRXFr5krMix3aQtG.full -->

## 13. Step 13
- Wait for the drive to copy (this could take several hours if you have a lot on your hard drive).
- When prompted for registration by SuperDuper!, either choose '''"Register"''' to purchase the software or '''"Later"''' to register later.
- After the copy is complete, click '''"Ok"''' and quit SuperDuper!
![Step 13 Image 1466291](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/Xb4XjLsm2UUCGu32.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/Xb4XjLsm2UUCGu32.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/Xb4XjLsm2UUCGu32.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/Xb4XjLsm2UUCGu32.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/Xb4XjLsm2UUCGu32.full -->
![Step 13 Image 1466292](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/YIu6oMbXYD54SZPF.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/YIu6oMbXYD54SZPF.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/YIu6oMbXYD54SZPF.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/YIu6oMbXYD54SZPF.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/YIu6oMbXYD54SZPF.full -->
![Step 13 Image 1466293](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/uXyMHarQMojYixMH.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/uXyMHarQMojYixMH.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/uXyMHarQMojYixMH.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/uXyMHarQMojYixMH.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/uXyMHarQMojYixMH.full -->

## 14. Step 14
- At this point, your new hard drive should be a clone of your existing drive and ready to install.
> **Note:** However, we recommend testing the cloned drive before physically swapping the drives. This can be done by attempting to boot from the new cloned drive through the USB enclosure.
- Keep the enclosure connected to the computer and restart the computer. Hold down the '''"option"''' key as it reboots until a boot option menu shows up.
![Step 14 Image 1466294](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/kEiBAkEof14FxRf4.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/kEiBAkEof14FxRf4.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/kEiBAkEof14FxRf4.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/kEiBAkEof14FxRf4.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/kEiBAkEof14FxRf4.full -->

## 15. Step 15
- Select your new hard drive from the boot option menu.
- Wait for the computer to boot up to verify if it works properly.
- Your new hard drive is now ready to be installed in your computer.
![Step 15 Image 273162](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/GcnVnreC3U2HWLyF.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/GcnVnreC3U2HWLyF.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/GcnVnreC3U2HWLyF.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/GcnVnreC3U2HWLyF.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/GcnVnreC3U2HWLyF.full -->

## Conclusion

Remove your new hard drive from the external enclosure and install it in your computer. Installation instructions are available for a variety of [[Topic:Mac|Macs]].

guides.title: How to apply scratch-proof coating
guides.raw_content:
# How to apply scratch-proof coating

Here you can see how to make any smartphone LCD or any touch screen device scratch proof / scratch resistant using Liquid Sapphire.

## 1. Step 1
- Use Liquid Sapphire scratch proof nanotechnology coating
![Step 1 Image 274838](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/i2DtovMeMZcanwQI.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/i2DtovMeMZcanwQI.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/i2DtovMeMZcanwQI.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/i2DtovMeMZcanwQI.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/i2DtovMeMZcanwQI.full -->

## 2. Step 2
- Add 3 drops of Liquid Sapphire to the LCD
![Step 2 Image 274839](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/O2d4LHOaEnrZZxWE.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/O2d4LHOaEnrZZxWE.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/O2d4LHOaEnrZZxWE.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/O2d4LHOaEnrZZxWE.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/O2d4LHOaEnrZZxWE.full -->

## 3. Step 3
- With a microfibre cloth wipe up and down until the LCD surface is covered.
![Step 3 Image 274840](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/XOjLVHgUh6QTIoZL.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/XOjLVHgUh6QTIoZL.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/XOjLVHgUh6QTIoZL.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/XOjLVHgUh6QTIoZL.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/XOjLVHgUh6QTIoZL.full -->

## 4. Step 4
- keep wiping up and down until a Grey/White coat starts forming, it will look similar to a widow smear.
![Step 4 Image 274841](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/hLaWWkPfwAdfRAYS.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/hLaWWkPfwAdfRAYS.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/hLaWWkPfwAdfRAYS.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/hLaWWkPfwAdfRAYS.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/hLaWWkPfwAdfRAYS.full -->

## 5. Step 5
- Leave to dry for 10 minuets and then buff off with a shammy (Chamois) Repeat the steps 3 times in total. The device can be used immediately. Keep clear of any objects that might scratch your screen until fully cured, in 24hrs.
![Step 5 Image 274843](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/yc2RHXW4sqs52dkh.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/yc2RHXW4sqs52dkh.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/yc2RHXW4sqs52dkh.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/yc2RHXW4sqs52dkh.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/yc2RHXW4sqs52dkh.full -->

## 6. Step 6
- Here is a coin scratching an iphone 5 LCD, watch and see what happens.

## Conclusion

To reassemble your device, follow these instructions in reverse order.

guides.title: Disassembling S by SFR 101 Made in China
guides.raw_content:
# Disassembling S by SFR 101 Made in China

## 1. Removing the Battery and Uncovering the Main Board
- Pop off the plastic back cover to reveal the battery.  Use a fingernail to lift up the battery from the top side. Under, you will see the SIM card slot.
- Using a Phillips screwdriver, unscrew the six screws holding in the back shell.
- Use a spudger to wedge between the seam of the front and back shell, and wedge the back shell up.
![Step 1 Image 3614128](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/gFVghbGGvvfUxjmT.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/gFVghbGGvvfUxjmT.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/gFVghbGGvvfUxjmT.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/gFVghbGGvvfUxjmT.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/gFVghbGGvvfUxjmT.full -->
![Step 1 Image 285260](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/utpRqAaJOtZSADrY.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/utpRqAaJOtZSADrY.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/utpRqAaJOtZSADrY.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/utpRqAaJOtZSADrY.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/utpRqAaJOtZSADrY.full -->
![Step 1 Image 3614130](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/JKRiDYGxuAjT3MUf.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/JKRiDYGxuAjT3MUf.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/JKRiDYGxuAjT3MUf.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/JKRiDYGxuAjT3MUf.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/JKRiDYGxuAjT3MUf.full -->

## 2. Step 2
- The main board, which holds the button board and the screen can easily lift out of the front shell.
- Remove the silicone button membrane using a finger or a spudger.
![Step 2 Image 3614135](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/6k3evQaBAObO6GCl.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/6k3evQaBAObO6GCl.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/6k3evQaBAObO6GCl.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/6k3evQaBAObO6GCl.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/6k3evQaBAObO6GCl.full -->
![Step 2 Image 285263](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/bHilmJgtQTEaYhLO.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/bHilmJgtQTEaYhLO.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/bHilmJgtQTEaYhLO.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/bHilmJgtQTEaYhLO.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/bHilmJgtQTEaYhLO.full -->
![Step 2 Image 285264](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/TMZ3DsGQDMEAyTaS.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/TMZ3DsGQDMEAyTaS.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/TMZ3DsGQDMEAyTaS.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/TMZ3DsGQDMEAyTaS.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/TMZ3DsGQDMEAyTaS.full -->

## 3. Step 3
- Congrats! You have made it to the end of this dissasemby. Now to assemble it back together...
![Step 3 Image 285265](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/dA5SCaBNdxgriPvE.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/dA5SCaBNdxgriPvE.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/dA5SCaBNdxgriPvE.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/dA5SCaBNdxgriPvE.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/dA5SCaBNdxgriPvE.full -->

## Conclusion

To reassemble your device, follow these instructions in reverse order.

guides.title: Change the Presser Foot on a Sewing Machine
guides.raw_content:
# Change the Presser Foot on a Sewing Machine

Swapping out the  [[Sewing Glossary#Section_Presser_Foot|presser foot]]  lets you create different stitches for different sewing tasks, such as buttonholes, zippers, zigzag, etc. Use this guide to change the presser foot in your sewing machine. We’re using a Bernina 830 for this procedure; sewing machines can vary, so check your sewing machine's owner’s manual for specific instructions.



[link|https://www.ifixit.com/collaborations/patagonia|Return to the Patagonia Care & Repair homepage|new_window=true].

## 1. Step 1
- Set the sewing machine needle to the upright position by turning the [[Sewing Glossary#Section_Balance_Wheel|balance wheel]] towards you.
- Release the presser foot lever by sliding it up.
> ⚠️ **Caution:** The presser foot will just fall out. Be ready to grab it.
![Step 1 Image 293993](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ygqo6UGSCAvXNBcc.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ygqo6UGSCAvXNBcc.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ygqo6UGSCAvXNBcc.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ygqo6UGSCAvXNBcc.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ygqo6UGSCAvXNBcc.full -->
![Step 1 Image 293995](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/WUP4BV1NI2ISEpEg.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/WUP4BV1NI2ISEpEg.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/WUP4BV1NI2ISEpEg.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/WUP4BV1NI2ISEpEg.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/WUP4BV1NI2ISEpEg.full -->

## 2. Step 2
- Pull the presser foot down and slide it off the peg on the machine.
> ⚠️ **Caution:** Be careful not to break the needle.
![Step 2 Image 293999](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/hCtjLVCCyIgYn6I5.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/hCtjLVCCyIgYn6I5.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/hCtjLVCCyIgYn6I5.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/hCtjLVCCyIgYn6I5.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/hCtjLVCCyIgYn6I5.full -->
![Step 2 Image 294002](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/WkLqMMEQAPemTXuH.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/WkLqMMEQAPemTXuH.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/WkLqMMEQAPemTXuH.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/WkLqMMEQAPemTXuH.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/WkLqMMEQAPemTXuH.full -->
![Step 2 Image 294004](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/DWyf1HAPbXqghxlW.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/DWyf1HAPbXqghxlW.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/DWyf1HAPbXqghxlW.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/DWyf1HAPbXqghxlW.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/DWyf1HAPbXqghxlW.full -->

## 3. Step 3
- Grab your desired presser foot, and orient it foot-down.
- Take the foot at an angle and slide the hole in the top of the presser foot onto the peg on the sewing machine.
![Step 3 Image 294008](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/BwOwdfiKmyxjPEMv.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/BwOwdfiKmyxjPEMv.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/BwOwdfiKmyxjPEMv.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/BwOwdfiKmyxjPEMv.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/BwOwdfiKmyxjPEMv.full -->
![Step 3 Image 294010](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/pQCtJYKVXkASXcPT.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/pQCtJYKVXkASXcPT.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/pQCtJYKVXkASXcPT.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/pQCtJYKVXkASXcPT.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/pQCtJYKVXkASXcPT.full -->
![Step 3 Image 294011](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/IapAsdnXCQDLOUh2.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/IapAsdnXCQDLOUh2.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/IapAsdnXCQDLOUh2.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/IapAsdnXCQDLOUh2.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/IapAsdnXCQDLOUh2.full -->

## 4. Step 4
- Slide the presser foot lever down to lock the new foot in place.
> ⚠️ **Caution:** Be sure to check your manual to see if you need to adjust the needle position. If it's not correctly adjusted, you may hit the needle on the presser foot and break the needle while sewing.
![Step 4 Image 294016](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/iBDSrEpYVJwyJOji.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/iBDSrEpYVJwyJOji.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/iBDSrEpYVJwyJOji.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/iBDSrEpYVJwyJOji.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/iBDSrEpYVJwyJOji.full -->
![Step 4 Image 294018](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/vlQLd36DokaRBQEm.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/vlQLd36DokaRBQEm.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/vlQLd36DokaRBQEm.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/vlQLd36DokaRBQEm.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/vlQLd36DokaRBQEm.full -->

guides.title: Creating a Buttonhole Using a Sewing Machine
guides.raw_content:
# Creating a Buttonhole Using a Sewing Machine

Use this guide to create a buttonhole with your sewing machine. We’re using a Bernina 830, but the process should be similar for all sewing machines with a mechanical buttonhole dial. Since every sewing machine is different, refer to your sewing machine’s owner’s manual for specific information. In this guide we’re using contrasting thread for visibility. When it comes time for your actual project, you’ll want to use thread that matches the color of your fabric.



[link|https://www.ifixit.com/collaborations/patagonia|Return to the Patagonia Care & Repair homepage|new_window=true].

## 1. Step 1
- Select your [[Sewing Glossary#Section_Buttonhole_Foot|buttonhole foot]]. Buttonhole feet can vary in appearance, so check you manual.
- Thread the buttonhole foot by sliding the thread through the diagonal slit into the center hole.
![Step 1 Image 293994](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/NBY6ePTegroWaVTI.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/NBY6ePTegroWaVTI.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/NBY6ePTegroWaVTI.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/NBY6ePTegroWaVTI.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/NBY6ePTegroWaVTI.full -->
![Step 1 Image 293997](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ZYwcs2nXULiDm2FI.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ZYwcs2nXULiDm2FI.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ZYwcs2nXULiDm2FI.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ZYwcs2nXULiDm2FI.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ZYwcs2nXULiDm2FI.full -->

## 2. Step 2
- Mark where you would like the top and bottom of the buttonhole to be with tailor's chalk.
> **Note:** You can measure your button if you aren't sure.
- Align the sewing machine at the upper left corner of the buttonhole.
![Step 2 Image 294000](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/YZS5GdxvSPniOxh1.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/YZS5GdxvSPniOxh1.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/YZS5GdxvSPniOxh1.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/YZS5GdxvSPniOxh1.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/YZS5GdxvSPniOxh1.full -->
![Step 2 Image 294003](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/Rh6OUUQAagLhWIUU.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/Rh6OUUQAagLhWIUU.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/Rh6OUUQAagLhWIUU.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/Rh6OUUQAagLhWIUU.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/Rh6OUUQAagLhWIUU.full -->

## 3. Step 3
- Lower the [[Sewing Glossary#Section_Presser_Foot|presser foot]].
![Step 3 Image 294006](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/srvUTShOrvvHiXVZ.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/srvUTShOrvvHiXVZ.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/srvUTShOrvvHiXVZ.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/srvUTShOrvvHiXVZ.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/srvUTShOrvvHiXVZ.full -->
![Step 3 Image 294009](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/Lv1weYPCXCZNOCoD.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/Lv1weYPCXCZNOCoD.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/Lv1weYPCXCZNOCoD.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/Lv1weYPCXCZNOCoD.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/Lv1weYPCXCZNOCoD.full -->

## 4. Step 4
- Set your stitch length dial to nearly zero, this will create a satin stitch. The usual stitch length is around the 2.5.
![Step 4 Image 294013](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/WYDlr4AlPtkTUeC3.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/WYDlr4AlPtkTUeC3.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/WYDlr4AlPtkTUeC3.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/WYDlr4AlPtkTUeC3.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/WYDlr4AlPtkTUeC3.full -->
![Step 4 Image 294015](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/VvapflBLfkaCitSE.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/VvapflBLfkaCitSE.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/VvapflBLfkaCitSE.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/VvapflBLfkaCitSE.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/VvapflBLfkaCitSE.full -->

## 5. Step 5
- Set your button hole dial to one. If you have an electronic sewing machine, refer to your manual.
> **Note:** Every time you adjust this dial, your needle will move. That's okay; it's supposed to do that.
- Start sewing. Sew to your second line.
![Step 5 Image 294019](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/VIGTN42udbNespoh.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/VIGTN42udbNespoh.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/VIGTN42udbNespoh.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/VIGTN42udbNespoh.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/VIGTN42udbNespoh.full -->
![Step 5 Image 294020](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/lBISdF4O4DjevA2g.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/lBISdF4O4DjevA2g.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/lBISdF4O4DjevA2g.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/lBISdF4O4DjevA2g.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/lBISdF4O4DjevA2g.full -->
![Step 5 Image 294021](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/UaYDAHQLEKtspdQf.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/UaYDAHQLEKtspdQf.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/UaYDAHQLEKtspdQf.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/UaYDAHQLEKtspdQf.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/UaYDAHQLEKtspdQf.full -->

## 6. Step 6
- Set your button hole dial to two.
- Sew the [[Sewing Glossary#Section_Bar_Tack|bar tack]] at the bottom of the buttonhole.
> **Note:** Setting the button hole dial to two tells your sewing machine what to do, all you need to do is sew a few stitches to create the bar tack.
![Step 6 Image 294025](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/6x3QE3ROaBYqUilT.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/6x3QE3ROaBYqUilT.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/6x3QE3ROaBYqUilT.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/6x3QE3ROaBYqUilT.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/6x3QE3ROaBYqUilT.full -->
![Step 6 Image 294027](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/tHnFGZtGsrrOewkb.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/tHnFGZtGsrrOewkb.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/tHnFGZtGsrrOewkb.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/tHnFGZtGsrrOewkb.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/tHnFGZtGsrrOewkb.full -->

## 7. Step 7
- Set your buttonhole dial to three.
- Sew up the second side of your buttonhole, stopping at your top mark.
![Step 7 Image 294031](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/6vhJcmrTFxBMYmN2.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/6vhJcmrTFxBMYmN2.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/6vhJcmrTFxBMYmN2.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/6vhJcmrTFxBMYmN2.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/6vhJcmrTFxBMYmN2.full -->
![Step 7 Image 294034](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/hpDAcZAR4DqNH1B1.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/hpDAcZAR4DqNH1B1.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/hpDAcZAR4DqNH1B1.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/hpDAcZAR4DqNH1B1.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/hpDAcZAR4DqNH1B1.full -->

## 8. Step 8
- Set your buttonhole dial to four.
- Sew the top bar tack at the top of the buttonhole.
![Step 8 Image 294037](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/glqREwmVgjXyH6pt.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/glqREwmVgjXyH6pt.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/glqREwmVgjXyH6pt.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/glqREwmVgjXyH6pt.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/glqREwmVgjXyH6pt.full -->
![Step 8 Image 294040](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/Wk1m1HIGjTxknbxk.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/Wk1m1HIGjTxknbxk.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/Wk1m1HIGjTxknbxk.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/Wk1m1HIGjTxknbxk.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/Wk1m1HIGjTxknbxk.full -->

## 9. Step 9
- Set your buttonhole dial to five.
- This setting [[Sewing Glossary#Section_Backstitch|backstitches]] to hold the thread in place. Sew a few more stitches, which will finish the buttonhole.
![Step 9 Image 294043](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/PlMiLsRtGnrHQMBR.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/PlMiLsRtGnrHQMBR.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/PlMiLsRtGnrHQMBR.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/PlMiLsRtGnrHQMBR.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/PlMiLsRtGnrHQMBR.full -->
![Step 9 Image 294045](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/xIdkZDmNklsJ2oCU.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/xIdkZDmNklsJ2oCU.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/xIdkZDmNklsJ2oCU.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/xIdkZDmNklsJ2oCU.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/xIdkZDmNklsJ2oCU.full -->

## 10. Step 10
- Clip the threads, freeing the fabric from the machine.
- Clip any extra loose threads.
![Step 10 Image 294048](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/O6K4mEEoHcCFjBMU.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/O6K4mEEoHcCFjBMU.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/O6K4mEEoHcCFjBMU.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/O6K4mEEoHcCFjBMU.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/O6K4mEEoHcCFjBMU.full -->
![Step 10 Image 294051](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/MPSXcxf2s6BCGo1G.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/MPSXcxf2s6BCGo1G.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/MPSXcxf2s6BCGo1G.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/MPSXcxf2s6BCGo1G.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/MPSXcxf2s6BCGo1G.full -->

## 11. Step 11
- Use a hobby knife to cut open the buttonhole.
> ⚠️ **Caution:** Be careful not to cut through the stitching, you only want to cut the fabric between the rows of stitching.
![Step 11 Image 294054](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/UNe5tvgmY13AYaSA.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/UNe5tvgmY13AYaSA.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/UNe5tvgmY13AYaSA.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/UNe5tvgmY13AYaSA.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/UNe5tvgmY13AYaSA.full -->
![Step 11 Image 294057](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/fVZBJHDyU4A5MqVs.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/fVZBJHDyU4A5MqVs.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/fVZBJHDyU4A5MqVs.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/fVZBJHDyU4A5MqVs.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/fVZBJHDyU4A5MqVs.full -->

guides.title: Learn to Sew a Straight Seam
guides.raw_content:
# Learn to Sew a Straight Seam

This guide will show you the most basic of seams, the [[Sewing Glossary#Section_Seam|straight seam]]. If this is your first sewing experience, practice on scraps of fabric. Like any skill, sewing requires practice—so take your time! The key is to work carefully and patiently. Sewing machines vary widely and may have different settings. This guide shows the process for a Bernina 830,  but the process will be similar for most machines. Refer to your sewing machine manual for information on specific settings and functions. In this guide we are using contrasting thread for visibility. When it comes time to do your actual project, you'll want to use thread that matches the color of your fabric.



[link|https://www.ifixit.com/collaborations/patagonia|Return to the Patagonia Care & Repair homepage|new_window=true].

## 1. Step 1
- Lay the two pieces of fabric with the [[Sewing Glossary#Section_Right_Sides_Together|right sides together]]. Align the edges you would like to sew. Push out all the wrinkles and smooth the fabric flat.
- Starting at one end of the seam, match the corners and pin them together.
![Step 1 Image 293996](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/qKYfxYWUnKANQYUT.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/qKYfxYWUnKANQYUT.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/qKYfxYWUnKANQYUT.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/qKYfxYWUnKANQYUT.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/qKYfxYWUnKANQYUT.full -->
![Step 1 Image 293998](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/5gJllTXvhVSV2EOT.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/5gJllTXvhVSV2EOT.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/5gJllTXvhVSV2EOT.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/5gJllTXvhVSV2EOT.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/5gJllTXvhVSV2EOT.full -->
![Step 1 Image 294001](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/EpCU5RMVGURpWcNO.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/EpCU5RMVGURpWcNO.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/EpCU5RMVGURpWcNO.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/EpCU5RMVGURpWcNO.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/EpCU5RMVGURpWcNO.full -->

## 2. Step 2
- Work your way down the edge to be sewn, pining the two pieces of fabric together.
> **Note:** The closer the pins are, the more stable the fabric will be. However, you will have to stop to remove each pin as you sew. If you're just getting started, use a pin every inch or two of fabric.
![Step 2 Image 294005](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/WZnICoJOd1JQPpSW.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/WZnICoJOd1JQPpSW.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/WZnICoJOd1JQPpSW.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/WZnICoJOd1JQPpSW.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/WZnICoJOd1JQPpSW.full -->
![Step 2 Image 294007](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/o5VdfUWrUuiWjCf4.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/o5VdfUWrUuiWjCf4.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/o5VdfUWrUuiWjCf4.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/o5VdfUWrUuiWjCf4.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/o5VdfUWrUuiWjCf4.full -->

## 3. Step 3
- Make sure the settings on your sewing machine are set to sew a straight stitch.
- Slide the corner of your fabric into the sewing machine, directly under the hole in the [[Sewing Glossary#Section_Pressor_Foot|presser foot]].
- Align the edge of your fabric with the edge of the pressor foot.
> **Note:** This will act as a guide while you sew, and will help you keep you seam straight. In this case, it will leave a quarter-inch [[Sewing Glossary#Section_Seam_Allowance|seam allowance]]. You can use a different guide if you would like.
- Lower the presser foot using the presser foot lever.
![Step 3 Image 294012](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/x5tUXCOFyXjVBCIV.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/x5tUXCOFyXjVBCIV.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/x5tUXCOFyXjVBCIV.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/x5tUXCOFyXjVBCIV.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/x5tUXCOFyXjVBCIV.full -->
![Step 3 Image 294014](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/YYUnsCbANj63IT4U.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/YYUnsCbANj63IT4U.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/YYUnsCbANj63IT4U.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/YYUnsCbANj63IT4U.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/YYUnsCbANj63IT4U.full -->
![Step 3 Image 294017](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/LJfsoEYlLg2LFsXa.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/LJfsoEYlLg2LFsXa.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/LJfsoEYlLg2LFsXa.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/LJfsoEYlLg2LFsXa.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/LJfsoEYlLg2LFsXa.full -->

## 4. Step 4
- Use the [[Sewing Glossary#Section_Balance_Wheel|balance wheel]] (also know as the hand wheel) to advance the sewing machine  until the needle has sunk into the fabric.
> ⚠️ **Caution:** The balance wheel should only be turned in the direction that advances the sewing machine. Usually, this means turning the wheel towards you. Turning the wheel in the opposite direction can ruin the tension on the sewing machine, causing it to jam. See your sewing machine manual for instructions specific to your machine.
![Step 4 Image 294022](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ZCIsw5JDI5yFIT6m.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ZCIsw5JDI5yFIT6m.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ZCIsw5JDI5yFIT6m.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ZCIsw5JDI5yFIT6m.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ZCIsw5JDI5yFIT6m.full -->
![Step 4 Image 294024](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/rLRuNICJXcHpjPoP.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/rLRuNICJXcHpjPoP.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/rLRuNICJXcHpjPoP.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/rLRuNICJXcHpjPoP.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/rLRuNICJXcHpjPoP.full -->

## 5. Step 5
- Engage your [[Sewing Glossary#Section_Backstitch|backstitch]] function.
> **Note:** Backstitch functions vary widely between machines and can come in the form of buttons, levers, and knobs. See your sewing machine manual for instructions on your backstitch function.
- Depress the pedal slowly. This will start the sewing machine sewing backwards.
- Sew two or three stitches backwards.
- Release the pedal.
- Release your backstitch function.
![Step 5 Image 294028](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/eOEb43aqnmRLtTTK.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/eOEb43aqnmRLtTTK.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/eOEb43aqnmRLtTTK.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/eOEb43aqnmRLtTTK.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/eOEb43aqnmRLtTTK.full -->
![Step 5 Image 294030](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/b6pMxZQO6mdY4RSH.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/b6pMxZQO6mdY4RSH.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/b6pMxZQO6mdY4RSH.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/b6pMxZQO6mdY4RSH.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/b6pMxZQO6mdY4RSH.full -->

## 6. Step 6
- Depress the pedal and sew slowly forward, guiding the fabric with your hands as you go.
> **Note:** When guiding the fabric through a sewing machine you should not be pushing or pulling. The machine will feed the fabric in at the right speed. Your job is merely to guide the fabric so the seam remains straight.
- Keep the fabric aligned to the edge of the presser foot as you sew.
- Stop before you reach each pin. Pull the pins out, being careful not to misalign the fabric.
![Step 6 Image 294033](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/nB6anAcFgWRAvSC1.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/nB6anAcFgWRAvSC1.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/nB6anAcFgWRAvSC1.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/nB6anAcFgWRAvSC1.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/nB6anAcFgWRAvSC1.full -->
![Step 6 Image 294036](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/MG1xA1wIMShCMNl2.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/MG1xA1wIMShCMNl2.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/MG1xA1wIMShCMNl2.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/MG1xA1wIMShCMNl2.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/MG1xA1wIMShCMNl2.full -->
![Step 6 Image 294038](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/FmcgdZMyMeB1rPb4.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/FmcgdZMyMeB1rPb4.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/FmcgdZMyMeB1rPb4.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/FmcgdZMyMeB1rPb4.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/FmcgdZMyMeB1rPb4.full -->

## 7. Step 7
- When you come to the end of your seam, engage the backstitch function.
- Sew two or three stitches backwards.
- Release the backstitch function and sew forward off the fabric.
- Turn the balance wheel until the needle is up.
![Step 7 Image 294041](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/OVtTCMwGBD2DhFpP.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/OVtTCMwGBD2DhFpP.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/OVtTCMwGBD2DhFpP.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/OVtTCMwGBD2DhFpP.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/OVtTCMwGBD2DhFpP.full -->
![Step 7 Image 294044](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/nJ1LKJ6CiH4pCIEW.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/nJ1LKJ6CiH4pCIEW.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/nJ1LKJ6CiH4pCIEW.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/nJ1LKJ6CiH4pCIEW.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/nJ1LKJ6CiH4pCIEW.full -->
![Step 7 Image 294046](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/guw5BcRuZmmjGefA.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/guw5BcRuZmmjGefA.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/guw5BcRuZmmjGefA.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/guw5BcRuZmmjGefA.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/guw5BcRuZmmjGefA.full -->

## 8. Step 8
- Lift the presser foot up.
![Step 8 Image 294049](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/Po5aPPYu5TaAhUAG.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/Po5aPPYu5TaAhUAG.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/Po5aPPYu5TaAhUAG.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/Po5aPPYu5TaAhUAG.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/Po5aPPYu5TaAhUAG.full -->
![Step 8 Image 294052](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/wGflaC5TV4dIYhAH.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/wGflaC5TV4dIYhAH.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/wGflaC5TV4dIYhAH.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/wGflaC5TV4dIYhAH.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/wGflaC5TV4dIYhAH.full -->

## 9. Step 9
- Pull the fabric out of the sewing machine.
> ⚠️ **Caution:** The threads are still attached to the sewing machine, so be careful not to pull too far or tangle the threads.
- Clip the threads as close to the fabric as possible.
- Turn your seam right side out, and admire your work.
![Step 9 Image 294055](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/PShWHk4CrwHk6SnB.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/PShWHk4CrwHk6SnB.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/PShWHk4CrwHk6SnB.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/PShWHk4CrwHk6SnB.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/PShWHk4CrwHk6SnB.full -->
![Step 9 Image 294058](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/t2PDYfKoaJhVpQiW.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/t2PDYfKoaJhVpQiW.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/t2PDYfKoaJhVpQiW.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/t2PDYfKoaJhVpQiW.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/t2PDYfKoaJhVpQiW.full -->

guides.title: Zigzag Stitch
guides.raw_content:
# Zigzag Stitch

The [[Sewing Glossary#Section_Zigzag_Stitch|zigzag stitch]] is a basic sewing skill and often used for stability or with stretchy fabrics. For this guide we’re using a Bernina 830 sewing machine, but the procedure should be similar on most machines with a mechanical stitch width dial. Check your sewing machine’s owner’s manual for instructions specific to your machine. In this guide we’re using contrasting thread for visibility. When it comes time to do your actual project, you’ll want to use thread that matches the color of your fabric.



[link|https://www.ifixit.com/collaborations/patagonia|Return to the Patagonia Care & Repair homepage|new_window=true].

## 1. Step 1
- Fit your sewing machine with a [[Sewing Glossary#Section_Presser_Foot|presser foot]] that has a wide hole.
- Set your sewing machine's stitch width to a three. This sets the machine to a typical zigzag stitch, but you can adjust to your taste. Zero is straight stitch, and the most drastic zigzag stitch maxes out at 4.
- Each machine is different; check your manual.
![Step 1 Image 294029](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/OKfL22Bt62FbDFao.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/OKfL22Bt62FbDFao.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/OKfL22Bt62FbDFao.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/OKfL22Bt62FbDFao.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/OKfL22Bt62FbDFao.full -->
![Step 1 Image 294032](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/kUIbxRLCj1OYWEtG.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/kUIbxRLCj1OYWEtG.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/kUIbxRLCj1OYWEtG.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/kUIbxRLCj1OYWEtG.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/kUIbxRLCj1OYWEtG.full -->

## 2. Step 2
- Insert your fabric into the sewing machine and depress the presser foot.
- [[Sewing Glossary#Section_Backstitch|Backstitch]] and begin sewing.
![Step 2 Image 294035](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/2QUWdWw1TdOr2LWr.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/2QUWdWw1TdOr2LWr.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/2QUWdWw1TdOr2LWr.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/2QUWdWw1TdOr2LWr.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/2QUWdWw1TdOr2LWr.full -->
![Step 2 Image 294039](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/sKsxDjeftXhaOlKk.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/sKsxDjeftXhaOlKk.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/sKsxDjeftXhaOlKk.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/sKsxDjeftXhaOlKk.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/sKsxDjeftXhaOlKk.full -->

## 3. Step 3
- Guide the fabric through the machine to keep the stitch straight.
> **Note:** When guiding the fabric through a sewing machine you should not be pushing or pulling. The machine will feed the fabric in at the right speed. Your job is merely to guide the fabric so the seam remains straight.
- Lift the presser foot, cut the threads, and voilà!
![Step 3 Image 294042](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/shctQPRdrXGlBv4F.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/shctQPRdrXGlBv4F.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/shctQPRdrXGlBv4F.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/shctQPRdrXGlBv4F.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/shctQPRdrXGlBv4F.full -->

guides.title: Installing Sewing Machine Bobbin
guides.raw_content:
# Installing Sewing Machine Bobbin

A bobbin is a small spool of thread that  feeds the thread for the backside of the stitch. No sewing machine can sew without one. An incorrectly set up bobbin will create tangles in the thread. [[Sewing Glossary#Section_Bobbin|Bobbin]] setups vary from machine to machine. This guide shows the process for a Bernina 830, but the process will be similar for most sewing machines, except for those with drop-in bobbins. Refer to your sewing machine’s owner’s manual for specific directions on how to install a bobbin in your machine.



[link|https://www.ifixit.com/collaborations/patagonia|Return to the Patagonia Care & Repair homepage|new_window=true].

## 1. Step 1
- Use your finger to open the bobbin door below the [[Sewing Glossary#Section_Pressor_Foot|presser foot]].
![Step 1 Image 294050](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/BYsKOV4KXMdalhtZ.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/BYsKOV4KXMdalhtZ.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/BYsKOV4KXMdalhtZ.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/BYsKOV4KXMdalhtZ.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/BYsKOV4KXMdalhtZ.full -->
![Step 1 Image 294053](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/daQCYXu4tWmXqJ3d.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/daQCYXu4tWmXqJ3d.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/daQCYXu4tWmXqJ3d.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/daQCYXu4tWmXqJ3d.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/daQCYXu4tWmXqJ3d.full -->

## 2. Step 2
- Align the hole in the [[Sewing Glossary#Section_Bobbin|bobbin spindle]] over the peg in the [[Sewing Glossary#Section_Bobbin_Case|bobbin case]].
- Slide the bobbin into the bobbin case, leaving a bit of thread outside the case.
- Take the loose thread end and slide it through the slit on the side of the bobbin case.
![Step 2 Image 297093](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/IywnvmTtLuyZyKQN.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/IywnvmTtLuyZyKQN.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/IywnvmTtLuyZyKQN.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/IywnvmTtLuyZyKQN.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/IywnvmTtLuyZyKQN.full -->
![Step 2 Image 294060](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/tyUKUFQ4gtbySG1i.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/tyUKUFQ4gtbySG1i.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/tyUKUFQ4gtbySG1i.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/tyUKUFQ4gtbySG1i.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/tyUKUFQ4gtbySG1i.full -->

## 3. Step 3
- Slide the thread from the slit straight up along the groove and into the open hole on  the bobbin case's side.
![Step 3 Image 294062](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/2bTYYvf1MaIgsK1k.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/2bTYYvf1MaIgsK1k.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/2bTYYvf1MaIgsK1k.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/2bTYYvf1MaIgsK1k.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/2bTYYvf1MaIgsK1k.full -->
![Step 3 Image 294063](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/RTJwUdamjYyS3PTA.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/RTJwUdamjYyS3PTA.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/RTJwUdamjYyS3PTA.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/RTJwUdamjYyS3PTA.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/RTJwUdamjYyS3PTA.full -->

## 4. Step 4
- Keeping the bobbin in place, turn the bobbin case so that the back is facing you.
- Use your fingernail to lift the lever on the back of the bobbin case. Hold the lever open.
![Step 4 Image 294065](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/EXVoIyJEECxeMjfG.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/EXVoIyJEECxeMjfG.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/EXVoIyJEECxeMjfG.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/EXVoIyJEECxeMjfG.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/EXVoIyJEECxeMjfG.full -->
![Step 4 Image 294067](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/RYFRBgbxUeaXpjTE.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/RYFRBgbxUeaXpjTE.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/RYFRBgbxUeaXpjTE.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/RYFRBgbxUeaXpjTE.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/RYFRBgbxUeaXpjTE.full -->

## 5. Step 5
- Holding the bobbin case lever open, insert the bobbin case into the cavity under the presser foot.
- Align the metal arm on the bobbin case so that it sits in the slot in the machine.
- Release the bobbin case.
![Step 5 Image 294069](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/Q1rbG1nZ1s1rvgH2.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/Q1rbG1nZ1s1rvgH2.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/Q1rbG1nZ1s1rvgH2.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/Q1rbG1nZ1s1rvgH2.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/Q1rbG1nZ1s1rvgH2.full -->
![Step 5 Image 294073](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/dEkkGQZW2USyPgyG.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/dEkkGQZW2USyPgyG.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/dEkkGQZW2USyPgyG.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/dEkkGQZW2USyPgyG.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/dEkkGQZW2USyPgyG.full -->

## 6. Step 6
- Close the door on the compartment below the presser foot.
![Step 6 Image 294075](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/4c1rywUyLeoUUhWS.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/4c1rywUyLeoUUhWS.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/4c1rywUyLeoUUhWS.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/4c1rywUyLeoUUhWS.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/4c1rywUyLeoUUhWS.full -->
![Step 6 Image 294077](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/31bGKuDJ2fBnrLcJ.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/31bGKuDJ2fBnrLcJ.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/31bGKuDJ2fBnrLcJ.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/31bGKuDJ2fBnrLcJ.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/31bGKuDJ2fBnrLcJ.full -->

guides.title: Press and Iron Fabrics
guides.raw_content:
# Press and Iron Fabrics

The techniques of pressing and ironing are often used interchangeably. Both use an iron, but each is a different technique. Ironing is the action of sliding the iron over fabric or a [[Sewing Glossary#Section_Seam|seam]]. Pressing involves resting the iron directly onto the fabric or seam, holding the iron in place, and then pulling it away. In pressing, there’s no sliding motion. Pressing protects delicate or loosely woven fabrics (such as silk or linen) from getting distorted while removing wrinkles. The ironing motion removes wrinkles from stable fabrics and proves particularly useful on large, single-layered fabrics.Once you’ve decided whether to press or iron your fabric, you’ll need to decide whether or not to steam the fabric as you proceed. Try a dry iron first, and only steam when there’s a stubborn wrinkle. Before steaming, be sure you’re using a fabric that won’t be harmed with water.



[link|https://www.ifixit.com/collaborations/patagonia|Return to the Patagonia Care & Repair homepage|new_window=true].

## 1. Press a Seam
- Set your iron to the appropriate fabric setting.
> **Note:** If your garment has more than one type of fabric, use the setting for the type of fabric with the lowest heat setting.
![Step 1 Image 294064](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/CsQANllQSSLxqkt2.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/CsQANllQSSLxqkt2.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/CsQANllQSSLxqkt2.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/CsQANllQSSLxqkt2.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/CsQANllQSSLxqkt2.full -->

## 2. Step 2
- Lay your wrinkly fabric or garment onto the ironing table.
- Make sure there is only one layer of fabric on the ironing board.
![Step 2 Image 294066](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/eDbhqg2UTw5gV4HA.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/eDbhqg2UTw5gV4HA.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/eDbhqg2UTw5gV4HA.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/eDbhqg2UTw5gV4HA.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/eDbhqg2UTw5gV4HA.full -->

## 3. Step 3
- Don't start ironing directly on the seam you want to flatten. Start on the fabric next to the seam. Bring the iron onto the fabric and then slide over the [[Sewing Glossary#Section_Seam|seam]].
> **Note:** Only iron in one direction. Each stroke should move the same way. After each stroke, lift the iron and start over.
> ⚠️ **Caution:** Do not push down. Allow the heat and weight of the iron to do the work.
![Step 3 Image 294068](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/Rhk6QTKVXHwZkySQ.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/Rhk6QTKVXHwZkySQ.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/Rhk6QTKVXHwZkySQ.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/Rhk6QTKVXHwZkySQ.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/Rhk6QTKVXHwZkySQ.full -->
![Step 3 Image 294070](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/CeTVke2Ys1TEZriJ.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/CeTVke2Ys1TEZriJ.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/CeTVke2Ys1TEZriJ.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/CeTVke2Ys1TEZriJ.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/CeTVke2Ys1TEZriJ.full -->

## 4. Ironing a Seam
- When ironing a seam, flip the project inside out so the seam is visible.
- Slide the fabric over the end of the ironing board, seam side up, so that only one layer of the fabric is ironed at a time.
![Step 4 Image 294072](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/cVJTZetSFDoANGih.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/cVJTZetSFDoANGih.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/cVJTZetSFDoANGih.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/cVJTZetSFDoANGih.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/cVJTZetSFDoANGih.full -->
![Step 4 Image 294074](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ajZML3R24b3Nhyd4.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ajZML3R24b3Nhyd4.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ajZML3R24b3Nhyd4.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ajZML3R24b3Nhyd4.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ajZML3R24b3Nhyd4.full -->

## 5. Step 5
- Using the same technique as above, work in one direction over the seam, ironing it flat.
- Work up the seam until the whole seam lays flat.
> **Note:** Allow the iron to do the work. Do not apply extra pressure. If you have a stubborn wrinkle, apply steam from your iron or mist the fabric with distilled water, then press the wrinkle.
![Step 5 Image 294076](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/VGSMa6PfolUUfDYU.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/VGSMa6PfolUUfDYU.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/VGSMa6PfolUUfDYU.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/VGSMa6PfolUUfDYU.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/VGSMa6PfolUUfDYU.full -->
![Step 5 Image 294078](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/dsPZfbKjXmmmtdNw.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/dsPZfbKjXmmmtdNw.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/dsPZfbKjXmmmtdNw.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/dsPZfbKjXmmmtdNw.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/dsPZfbKjXmmmtdNw.full -->
![Step 5 Image 294079](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/261WZ6IECQbwImcu.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/261WZ6IECQbwImcu.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/261WZ6IECQbwImcu.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/261WZ6IECQbwImcu.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/261WZ6IECQbwImcu.full -->

## 6. Step 6
- To press a seam, open the seam up by separating the two pieces of fabric in the seam.
- Take the iron and go directly down onto the seam.
- Do not move the iron, simply let the iron sit on the seam for 10-30 seconds. Lift and repeat.
> **Note:** Allow the iron to do the work. Don't apply lots of pressure. If you have a stubborn wrinkle, apply steam from your iron, or mist the fabric with distilled water before pressing.
![Step 6 Image 294080](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/fuWU6UC2UulRyIVD.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/fuWU6UC2UulRyIVD.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/fuWU6UC2UulRyIVD.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/fuWU6UC2UulRyIVD.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/fuWU6UC2UulRyIVD.full -->
![Step 6 Image 294081](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/dBlDdDqPIi32o3mU.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/dBlDdDqPIi32o3mU.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/dBlDdDqPIi32o3mU.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/dBlDdDqPIi32o3mU.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/dBlDdDqPIi32o3mU.full -->
![Step 6 Image 294082](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/OwbnR5OqTPDoZo6K.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/OwbnR5OqTPDoZo6K.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/OwbnR5OqTPDoZo6K.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/OwbnR5OqTPDoZo6K.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/OwbnR5OqTPDoZo6K.full -->
