guides.title: Sewing a Curved Seam
guides.raw_content:
# Sewing a Curved Seam

Learn how to sew a curved seam to give your garments shape and life, not just straight lines. In this guide we’re using contrasting thread for visibility, but when it comes time to do your actual project, you’ll want to use thread that matches the color of your fabric.



[link|https://www.ifixit.com/collaborations/patagonia|Return to the Patagonia Care & Repair homepage|new_window=true].

## 1. Step 1
- Lay the two pieces of fabric with the [[Sewing Glossary#Section_Right_Sides_Together|right sides together]].
- Align the edges you would like to sew. Push out all the wrinkles and smooth the fabric flat.
![Step 1 Image 294084](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/iDNJMLCku2DAVSb5.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/iDNJMLCku2DAVSb5.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/iDNJMLCku2DAVSb5.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/iDNJMLCku2DAVSb5.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/iDNJMLCku2DAVSb5.full -->
![Step 1 Image 294085](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/65L452ECl1sJOrJl.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/65L452ECl1sJOrJl.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/65L452ECl1sJOrJl.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/65L452ECl1sJOrJl.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/65L452ECl1sJOrJl.full -->

## 2. Step 2
- Starting at one end of the seam, match the corners and [[Sewing Glossary#Section_Pins|pin]] them together.
- Work your way down the edge to be sewn, pinning the two pieces of fabric together.
> **Note:** The closer the pins are, the more stable their hold will be. However, you will have to stop to remove each pin as you sew. For a beginner's skill level, space the pins an inch or two apart.
- Continue until you've pinned the two pieces of fabric from corner to corner.
![Step 2 Image 294086](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/tymfMM5PTeKCj5RI.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/tymfMM5PTeKCj5RI.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/tymfMM5PTeKCj5RI.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/tymfMM5PTeKCj5RI.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/tymfMM5PTeKCj5RI.full -->
![Step 2 Image 294087](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/11HWJcTh4wSY1PUy.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/11HWJcTh4wSY1PUy.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/11HWJcTh4wSY1PUy.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/11HWJcTh4wSY1PUy.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/11HWJcTh4wSY1PUy.full -->
![Step 2 Image 294088](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/FabHMwWITctZkKmF.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/FabHMwWITctZkKmF.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/FabHMwWITctZkKmF.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/FabHMwWITctZkKmF.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/FabHMwWITctZkKmF.full -->

## 3. Step 3
- Align the edge of the fabric with the edge of the [[Sewing Glossary#Section_Presser_Foot|presser foot]], then depress the presser foot.
- Engage the sewing machine's [[Sewing Glossary#Section_Backstitch|backstitch function]].
> **Note:** Backstitch functions vary widely between machines and can come in the form of buttons, levers, and knobs. See your sewing machine manual for instructions on your backstitch function.
- Depress the [[Sewing Glossary#Section_Pedal|pedal]] slowly. Sew two or three stitches backwards. Release the pedal and disengage the backstitch function.
![Step 3 Image 294089](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/lI5LF36OqKbHGxUR.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/lI5LF36OqKbHGxUR.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/lI5LF36OqKbHGxUR.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/lI5LF36OqKbHGxUR.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/lI5LF36OqKbHGxUR.full -->
![Step 3 Image 294090](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/k2g1lPTP126daHSA.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/k2g1lPTP126daHSA.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/k2g1lPTP126daHSA.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/k2g1lPTP126daHSA.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/k2g1lPTP126daHSA.full -->
![Step 3 Image 294091](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/eKFDn2VdJjKmNFA1.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/eKFDn2VdJjKmNFA1.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/eKFDn2VdJjKmNFA1.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/eKFDn2VdJjKmNFA1.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/eKFDn2VdJjKmNFA1.full -->

## 4. Step 4
- Depress the pedal and sew slowly forward, guiding the fabric with your hands as you go.
> **Note:** When guiding the fabric through a sewing machine you should not be pushing or pulling. The machine will feed the fabric in at the right speed. Your job is merely to guide the fabric so the seam remains straight.
- Keep the fabric aligned to the edge of the presser foot as you sew.
- Stop before you reach each pin. Pull the pins out, being careful not to misalign the fabric.
![Step 4 Image 294092](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/YOOwOFT1qXXSXYuM.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/YOOwOFT1qXXSXYuM.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/YOOwOFT1qXXSXYuM.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/YOOwOFT1qXXSXYuM.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/YOOwOFT1qXXSXYuM.full -->
![Step 4 Image 294093](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/kQiNVAZrfvAp3yB1.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/kQiNVAZrfvAp3yB1.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/kQiNVAZrfvAp3yB1.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/kQiNVAZrfvAp3yB1.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/kQiNVAZrfvAp3yB1.full -->
![Step 4 Image 294094](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/nxPFsfwNTUd2OkkW.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/nxPFsfwNTUd2OkkW.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/nxPFsfwNTUd2OkkW.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/nxPFsfwNTUd2OkkW.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/nxPFsfwNTUd2OkkW.full -->

## 5. Step 5
- Continue to sew along the curved edge.
- Pull out the last pin and sew up to the fabric's end.
- When you come to the end of your seam, engage the backstitch function. Sew two or three stitches backwards. Release the backstitch function and sew forward off the fabric.
- Turn the [[Sewing Glossary#Section_Balance_Wheel|balance wheel]] until the needle is up.
- Lift the presser foot up and clip the threads holding the fabric to the machine as close to the fabric as possible.
![Step 5 Image 294095](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/BKOjUvYDukxePdtT.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/BKOjUvYDukxePdtT.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/BKOjUvYDukxePdtT.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/BKOjUvYDukxePdtT.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/BKOjUvYDukxePdtT.full -->
![Step 5 Image 294096](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/4yFshQZWZJIhWeu6.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/4yFshQZWZJIhWeu6.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/4yFshQZWZJIhWeu6.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/4yFshQZWZJIhWeu6.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/4yFshQZWZJIhWeu6.full -->
![Step 5 Image 294097](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/atFPcZMMrgDGodrl.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/atFPcZMMrgDGodrl.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/atFPcZMMrgDGodrl.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/atFPcZMMrgDGodrl.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/atFPcZMMrgDGodrl.full -->

## 6. Step 6
- Lay out the newly sewn fabric on your work surface.
- With a pair of fabric scissors, make a series of cuts about 1 cm apart into the raw edge of the seam until the fabric begins to curve. This will ensure that the seam lays flat.
> ⚠️ **Caution:** Do not cut the seam itself, or you will have to resew the section.
![Step 6 Image 294098](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/HxDuNZWNJCywnVBf.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/HxDuNZWNJCywnVBf.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/HxDuNZWNJCywnVBf.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/HxDuNZWNJCywnVBf.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/HxDuNZWNJCywnVBf.full -->
![Step 6 Image 294099](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/QSIjdtquTuyhlBN2.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/QSIjdtquTuyhlBN2.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/QSIjdtquTuyhlBN2.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/QSIjdtquTuyhlBN2.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/QSIjdtquTuyhlBN2.full -->

## 7. Step 7
- Once the edge of the fabric begins to curve, begin cutting small triangles about every inch along the edge with the point facing towards the seam.
> **Note:** The more triangles you cut, the smoother your seam will lay.
- Continue cutting small triangles along the length of the fabric.
> **Note:** As with the beginning, you may simply cut slits into the straight sections, while curved edges require triangles.
![Step 7 Image 294100](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/grGBcqWIahD2YdPO.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/grGBcqWIahD2YdPO.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/grGBcqWIahD2YdPO.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/grGBcqWIahD2YdPO.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/grGBcqWIahD2YdPO.full -->
![Step 7 Image 294101](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/CZPoYdJQcKTsNIqb.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/CZPoYdJQcKTsNIqb.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/CZPoYdJQcKTsNIqb.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/CZPoYdJQcKTsNIqb.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/CZPoYdJQcKTsNIqb.full -->
![Step 7 Image 294102](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/SdGfCebNYOqGdlmY.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/SdGfCebNYOqGdlmY.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/SdGfCebNYOqGdlmY.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/SdGfCebNYOqGdlmY.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/SdGfCebNYOqGdlmY.full -->

## 8. Step 8
- Once you have cut triangles all along the seam, turn the fabric inside out so that the seam is now on the inside.
- As you turn the fabric inside out, adjust the fabric at the raw edge of the seam to get the smoothest seam possible.
- Once your fabric is inside-out and your seam is flat, stand back and admire your beautiful handiwork.
![Step 8 Image 294103](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/BqcyEMkNvQZSD3yP.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/BqcyEMkNvQZSD3yP.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/BqcyEMkNvQZSD3yP.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/BqcyEMkNvQZSD3yP.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/BqcyEMkNvQZSD3yP.full -->
![Step 8 Image 294104](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/dpOqBPDDXZevXpFC.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/dpOqBPDDXZevXpFC.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/dpOqBPDDXZevXpFC.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/dpOqBPDDXZevXpFC.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/dpOqBPDDXZevXpFC.full -->

## Conclusion

To reassemble your device, follow these instructions in reverse order.

guides.title: Thread a Sewing Machine
guides.raw_content:
# Thread a Sewing Machine

You don’t need a sewing machine to sew. But a machine can save you a lot of time when you make repairs, so if you have access to a sewing machine, here’s how to thread it. In this guide we’re using a Bernina 830, but the process will be similar for most sewing machines. Refer to your sewing machine’s owner’s manual for specific directions on how to thread the machine.



[link|https://www.ifixit.com/collaborations/patagonia|Return to the Patagonia Care & Repair homepage|new_window=true].

## 1. Step 1
- Place a spool on the pin. Pull the [[Sewing Glossary#Section_Thread|thread]] from the spool straight out, following the length of the machine.
- Hook the thread under the eyelet on the outer edge of the machine.
- With one hand, hold the spool steady. Using the eyelet as a pivot, pull the string perpendicular with the other hand. Lay the thread into the slot, which bisects the top of the machine.
![Step 1 Image 294106](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/BwXMSMKWw5EsOGcG.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/BwXMSMKWw5EsOGcG.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/BwXMSMKWw5EsOGcG.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/BwXMSMKWw5EsOGcG.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/BwXMSMKWw5EsOGcG.full -->
![Step 1 Image 294107](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/WRNoLITd1YRCyqXw.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/WRNoLITd1YRCyqXw.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/WRNoLITd1YRCyqXw.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/WRNoLITd1YRCyqXw.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/WRNoLITd1YRCyqXw.full -->
![Step 1 Image 294108](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/IaobXnFyoVrDcsAc.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/IaobXnFyoVrDcsAc.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/IaobXnFyoVrDcsAc.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/IaobXnFyoVrDcsAc.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/IaobXnFyoVrDcsAc.full -->

## 2. Step 2
- Pull the thread all the way across the slot on the top of the sewing machine. Then, pull the thread down toward the [[Sewing Glossary#Section_Presser_Foot|presser foot]].
- There is a lever just above the presser foot. Hook the thread under the lever until it rests in the crux.
- Pull the thread back up toward the top of the machine.
![Step 2 Image 294109](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/xbMap3PPnnXFsGWL.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/xbMap3PPnnXFsGWL.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/xbMap3PPnnXFsGWL.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/xbMap3PPnnXFsGWL.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/xbMap3PPnnXFsGWL.full -->
![Step 2 Image 294110](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/IxPifhOHuIP5yjVP.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/IxPifhOHuIP5yjVP.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/IxPifhOHuIP5yjVP.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/IxPifhOHuIP5yjVP.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/IxPifhOHuIP5yjVP.full -->
![Step 2 Image 294111](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/xVyZY1wdbXvhhyoG.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/xVyZY1wdbXvhhyoG.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/xVyZY1wdbXvhhyoG.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/xVyZY1wdbXvhhyoG.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/xVyZY1wdbXvhhyoG.full -->

## 3. Step 3
- At the top of the machine, lead the thread along the groove of the [[Sewing Glossary#Section_Take_up_Lever|take-up lever]].
- Once you've fed the thread into the crux of the take-up lever, pull the thread back down towards the presser foot.
> **Note:** If you've threaded correctly, your thread should form a complete zigzag—first down, then up, then back down all the way to the presser foot.
![Step 3 Image 294112](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/HDSJXwpmhScAQWn5.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/HDSJXwpmhScAQWn5.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/HDSJXwpmhScAQWn5.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/HDSJXwpmhScAQWn5.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/HDSJXwpmhScAQWn5.full -->
![Step 3 Image 294113](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/NOpO4trBDsxDtxSL.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/NOpO4trBDsxDtxSL.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/NOpO4trBDsxDtxSL.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/NOpO4trBDsxDtxSL.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/NOpO4trBDsxDtxSL.full -->
![Step 3 Image 294114](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/bSXfFhaOVC2SXkyw.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/bSXfFhaOVC2SXkyw.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/bSXfFhaOVC2SXkyw.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/bSXfFhaOVC2SXkyw.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/bSXfFhaOVC2SXkyw.full -->

## 4. Step 4
- Hook the thread behind the small, bent arm where the needle attaches to the machine.
- Guide the thread, from front to back, through the eye of the needle, leaving a loose end of approximately 10 cm.
> **Note:** If the end of your thread has frayed and you cannot guide it through the eye of the needle, snip off the frayed end and try again.
![Step 4 Image 294115](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/gPkTPcn6mwS3meKF.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/gPkTPcn6mwS3meKF.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/gPkTPcn6mwS3meKF.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/gPkTPcn6mwS3meKF.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/gPkTPcn6mwS3meKF.full -->
![Step 4 Image 294116](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/djZAHm5LHbIk1uyq.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/djZAHm5LHbIk1uyq.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/djZAHm5LHbIk1uyq.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/djZAHm5LHbIk1uyq.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/djZAHm5LHbIk1uyq.full -->

## 5. Step 5
- After you've guided the thread through the eye of the needle, pull the thread down and through the large groove in the presser foot.
- Hook the thread along the groove and pull it perpendicular toward the body of the machine.
![Step 5 Image 294117](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/RE6JFn14seEayv51.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/RE6JFn14seEayv51.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/RE6JFn14seEayv51.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/RE6JFn14seEayv51.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/RE6JFn14seEayv51.full -->
![Step 5 Image 294118](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/XI2XJU4XVqeWRTIF.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/XI2XJU4XVqeWRTIF.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/XI2XJU4XVqeWRTIF.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/XI2XJU4XVqeWRTIF.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/XI2XJU4XVqeWRTIF.full -->

## 6. Step 6
- While continuing to hold the top thread advance the sewing machine with the [[Sewing Glossary#Section_Balance_Wheel|balance wheel]] (also know as the hand wheel), to pick up the [[Sewing Glossary#Section_Bobbin|bobbin]] thread.
> ⚠️ **Caution:** Only turn the balance wheel in the direction that advances the machine. Usually, this means turning the wheel towards you. Turning the wheel in the opposite direction can ruin the tension on the sewing machine, causing it to jam. See your sewing machine manual for instructions specific to your machine.
- Grasp these two threads between pinched fingers and pull them in unison toward the body of the machine, leaving two to three inch tails.
![Step 6 Image 294119](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/62ANuijKkqUwRBS5.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/62ANuijKkqUwRBS5.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/62ANuijKkqUwRBS5.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/62ANuijKkqUwRBS5.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/62ANuijKkqUwRBS5.full -->
![Step 6 Image 294120](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/NBfbOnNNQgxIPQYq.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/NBfbOnNNQgxIPQYq.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/NBfbOnNNQgxIPQYq.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/NBfbOnNNQgxIPQYq.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/NBfbOnNNQgxIPQYq.full -->
![Step 6 Image 294121](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/IVP5jCYxnldVJVHs.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/IVP5jCYxnldVJVHs.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/IVP5jCYxnldVJVHs.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/IVP5jCYxnldVJVHs.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/IVP5jCYxnldVJVHs.full -->

## 7. Step 7
- Slide the sewing machine table onto the machine.
- Hold the sewing machine table so that is lays flush with the sewing machine.
![Step 7 Image 294122](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/CLwVRwRTPGBgIK3d.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/CLwVRwRTPGBgIK3d.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/CLwVRwRTPGBgIK3d.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/CLwVRwRTPGBgIK3d.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/CLwVRwRTPGBgIK3d.full -->
![Step 7 Image 294123](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/B4YLBKI3kgT5fSL4.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/B4YLBKI3kgT5fSL4.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/B4YLBKI3kgT5fSL4.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/B4YLBKI3kgT5fSL4.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/B4YLBKI3kgT5fSL4.full -->

## 8. Step 8
- Lock the sewing machine table into place by pushing the clamp lever to the right until it engages.
![Step 8 Image 294124](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/jHCIvELMcdJK6UZ5.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/jHCIvELMcdJK6UZ5.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/jHCIvELMcdJK6UZ5.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/jHCIvELMcdJK6UZ5.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/jHCIvELMcdJK6UZ5.full -->
![Step 8 Image 294125](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/TYyWE5CPplF5moTl.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/TYyWE5CPplF5moTl.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/TYyWE5CPplF5moTl.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/TYyWE5CPplF5moTl.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/TYyWE5CPplF5moTl.full -->

guides.title: CCI Smart Strip 04941 Teardown
guides.raw_content:
# CCI Smart Strip 04941 Teardown

## 1. Step 1
- The Assembled Product, unplugged from wall
![Step 1 Image 294493](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/r6ammNq2RYufKZbN.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/r6ammNq2RYufKZbN.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/r6ammNq2RYufKZbN.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/r6ammNq2RYufKZbN.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/r6ammNq2RYufKZbN.full -->

## 2. Step 2
- Turn Smart Strip upside down and locate  four screw holes in corners
- Unscrew four corner screws with #0 Phillips Screwdriver
![Step 2 Image 294532](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/bNPTJy3HFQ3alJli.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/bNPTJy3HFQ3alJli.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/bNPTJy3HFQ3alJli.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/bNPTJy3HFQ3alJli.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/bNPTJy3HFQ3alJli.full -->
![Step 2 Image 294594](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/fJSH1TDyJMKh63Xo.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/fJSH1TDyJMKh63Xo.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/fJSH1TDyJMKh63Xo.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/fJSH1TDyJMKh63Xo.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/fJSH1TDyJMKh63Xo.full -->

## 3. Step 3
- Locate four latch slots in case
- Use 2.4mm Slotted Screwdriver, put tip into center of slot, with tip on outer edge of slot, and press inward
![Step 3 Image 294541](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/xHQUDnDXWkUcuVJB.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/xHQUDnDXWkUcuVJB.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/xHQUDnDXWkUcuVJB.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/xHQUDnDXWkUcuVJB.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/xHQUDnDXWkUcuVJB.full -->
![Step 3 Image 294539](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/KuxfVYxB1YQqkC5p.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/KuxfVYxB1YQqkC5p.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/KuxfVYxB1YQqkC5p.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/KuxfVYxB1YQqkC5p.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/KuxfVYxB1YQqkC5p.full -->

## 4. Step 4
- Take two halves of case apart with your hands
![Step 4 Image 294545](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/fl4cj5iYHxuMUQTR.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/fl4cj5iYHxuMUQTR.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/fl4cj5iYHxuMUQTR.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/fl4cj5iYHxuMUQTR.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/fl4cj5iYHxuMUQTR.full -->
![Step 4 Image 294566](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/KKMaJaZJ2tVmQlPO.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/KKMaJaZJ2tVmQlPO.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/KKMaJaZJ2tVmQlPO.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/KKMaJaZJ2tVmQlPO.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/KKMaJaZJ2tVmQlPO.full -->

## 5. Step 5
- Lift Ground Copper Strip upward off of power plugs by hand
![Step 5 Image 294602](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/1JWVOk64BVYJPBQN.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/1JWVOk64BVYJPBQN.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/1JWVOk64BVYJPBQN.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/1JWVOk64BVYJPBQN.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/1JWVOk64BVYJPBQN.full -->

## 6. Step 6
- Locate latch securing power plugs to bottom of case
- Using slotted 2.4mm screwdriver, pry latch away from power plugs to loosen power plugs
![Step 6 Image 294580](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/etdkJRTvFDS2PhwD.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/etdkJRTvFDS2PhwD.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/etdkJRTvFDS2PhwD.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/etdkJRTvFDS2PhwD.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/etdkJRTvFDS2PhwD.full -->
![Step 6 Image 294581](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/DCIEcCkDUdZeWtGn.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/DCIEcCkDUdZeWtGn.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/DCIEcCkDUdZeWtGn.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/DCIEcCkDUdZeWtGn.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/DCIEcCkDUdZeWtGn.full -->

## 7. Step 7
- Lift power plugs out of bottom of case along with circuit assembly
![Step 7 Image 294584](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/Ab6aOL5oU5ntDjKp.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/Ab6aOL5oU5ntDjKp.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/Ab6aOL5oU5ntDjKp.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/Ab6aOL5oU5ntDjKp.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/Ab6aOL5oU5ntDjKp.full -->
![Step 7 Image 294585](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/M1ys2osNiOAS45W1.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/M1ys2osNiOAS45W1.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/M1ys2osNiOAS45W1.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/M1ys2osNiOAS45W1.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/M1ys2osNiOAS45W1.full -->

guides.title: Sew a Button
guides.raw_content:
# Sew a Button

Replacing a button is one of the most common clothing repairs. Fortunately, it's also one of the easiest. This guide will show you how to reattach a standard four-hole button with a needle and thread. In this guide we're using contrasting thread for visibility, but when it comes time to do your actual project, you'll want to use thread that matches the color of your fabric.



[link|https://www.ifixit.com/collaborations/patagonia|Return to the Patagonia Care & Repair homepage|new_window=true].

## 1. Step 1
- Locate the area where the button has gone missing.
![Step 1 Image 294634](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/AJVRFKIRQqGFxDLB.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/AJVRFKIRQqGFxDLB.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/AJVRFKIRQqGFxDLB.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/AJVRFKIRQqGFxDLB.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/AJVRFKIRQqGFxDLB.full -->

## 2. Step 2
- Overlap the buttonhole with where the button should be. Going through the buttonhole, mark the fabric below with tailor's chalk.
![Step 2 Image 294635](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/xHDiqMCGNLIONvIX.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/xHDiqMCGNLIONvIX.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/xHDiqMCGNLIONvIX.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/xHDiqMCGNLIONvIX.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/xHDiqMCGNLIONvIX.full -->
![Step 2 Image 294636](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/IYlNPtYPidjEDlJ3.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/IYlNPtYPidjEDlJ3.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/IYlNPtYPidjEDlJ3.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/IYlNPtYPidjEDlJ3.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/IYlNPtYPidjEDlJ3.full -->

## 3. Step 3
- Get a [[Sewing Glossary#Section_Thread|length of thread]]—about an arms-length should be more than enough.
- Thread a needle.
![Step 3 Image 294637](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/sMJXoxLtE2WWTXHF.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/sMJXoxLtE2WWTXHF.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/sMJXoxLtE2WWTXHF.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/sMJXoxLtE2WWTXHF.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/sMJXoxLtE2WWTXHF.full -->
![Step 3 Image 294638](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/VgRTo1cdUHtr3ffS.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/VgRTo1cdUHtr3ffS.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/VgRTo1cdUHtr3ffS.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/VgRTo1cdUHtr3ffS.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/VgRTo1cdUHtr3ffS.full -->

## 4. Step 4
- Let the needle slide down the thread until it hangs at the center. You should have two equal lengths of thread on either side of the needle.
- Tie the loose ends of the thread together.
![Step 4 Image 294639](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/qVjctxHX1X5VACqD.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/qVjctxHX1X5VACqD.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/qVjctxHX1X5VACqD.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/qVjctxHX1X5VACqD.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/qVjctxHX1X5VACqD.full -->
![Step 4 Image 294641](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/OjIipWpXQihXkVmo.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/OjIipWpXQihXkVmo.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/OjIipWpXQihXkVmo.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/OjIipWpXQihXkVmo.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/OjIipWpXQihXkVmo.full -->
![Step 4 Image 294642](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ukuAc5hLEEgNX2Ve.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ukuAc5hLEEgNX2Ve.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ukuAc5hLEEgNX2Ve.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ukuAc5hLEEgNX2Ve.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ukuAc5hLEEgNX2Ve.full -->

## 5. Step 5
- Tie a second regular knot over the first one to make it bigger. You don't want the thread slipping right through the grain of the fabric.
![Step 5 Image 294643](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/Sig4y5YiAhTnmMjn.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/Sig4y5YiAhTnmMjn.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/Sig4y5YiAhTnmMjn.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/Sig4y5YiAhTnmMjn.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/Sig4y5YiAhTnmMjn.full -->
![Step 5 Image 294644](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/AMQ2EnQEOOUPoiMp.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/AMQ2EnQEOOUPoiMp.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/AMQ2EnQEOOUPoiMp.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/AMQ2EnQEOOUPoiMp.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/AMQ2EnQEOOUPoiMp.full -->

## 6. Step 6
- Poke the needle up through the chalk mark  from the underside of the fabric.
- Pull the thread taut, until the knot catches the backside of the fabric.
![Step 6 Image 294645](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/CMBjOgJDUCuD62hx.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/CMBjOgJDUCuD62hx.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/CMBjOgJDUCuD62hx.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/CMBjOgJDUCuD62hx.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/CMBjOgJDUCuD62hx.full -->
![Step 6 Image 294646](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/WZbmU6QTPuVUkctr.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/WZbmU6QTPuVUkctr.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/WZbmU6QTPuVUkctr.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/WZbmU6QTPuVUkctr.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/WZbmU6QTPuVUkctr.full -->
![Step 6 Image 294647](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/2DnAGNexKoCYPQ2C.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/2DnAGNexKoCYPQ2C.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/2DnAGNexKoCYPQ2C.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/2DnAGNexKoCYPQ2C.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/2DnAGNexKoCYPQ2C.full -->

## 7. Step 7
- Thread the needle through one hole of the button. You can pick any hole to start with.
- Let the button drop all the way down onto the fabric.
![Step 7 Image 294648](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/h3LUxFoPeNvk6GlM.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/h3LUxFoPeNvk6GlM.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/h3LUxFoPeNvk6GlM.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/h3LUxFoPeNvk6GlM.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/h3LUxFoPeNvk6GlM.full -->
![Step 7 Image 294649](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/q1gCegrZSSGZRRwi.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/q1gCegrZSSGZRRwi.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/q1gCegrZSSGZRRwi.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/q1gCegrZSSGZRRwi.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/q1gCegrZSSGZRRwi.full -->

## 8. Step 8
- Push the needle through the buttonhole directly opposite the one you have already threaded.
- Be sure to go through only the button, not the fabric.
![Step 8 Image 294650](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/fUhSLJUivRxjrNQi.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/fUhSLJUivRxjrNQi.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/fUhSLJUivRxjrNQi.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/fUhSLJUivRxjrNQi.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/fUhSLJUivRxjrNQi.full -->
![Step 8 Image 294651](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/yJF2QSMkKd4T2AmG.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/yJF2QSMkKd4T2AmG.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/yJF2QSMkKd4T2AmG.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/yJF2QSMkKd4T2AmG.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/yJF2QSMkKd4T2AmG.full -->
![Step 8 Image 294652](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/DVFNgtJvjRLIukfU.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/DVFNgtJvjRLIukfU.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/DVFNgtJvjRLIukfU.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/DVFNgtJvjRLIukfU.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/DVFNgtJvjRLIukfU.full -->

## 9. Step 9
- Push the needle back through the fabric directly next to where you initially pushed the needle up.
- Pull the thread taut, until the button lays flat on the fabric.
![Step 9 Image 294653](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/AT2HYdNIVfoYUfpA.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/AT2HYdNIVfoYUfpA.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/AT2HYdNIVfoYUfpA.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/AT2HYdNIVfoYUfpA.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/AT2HYdNIVfoYUfpA.full -->
![Step 9 Image 294654](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/rhD1hXVm2ohEPflJ.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/rhD1hXVm2ohEPflJ.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/rhD1hXVm2ohEPflJ.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/rhD1hXVm2ohEPflJ.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/rhD1hXVm2ohEPflJ.full -->
![Step 9 Image 294655](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/NmW6Nf2ipgPBZW4C.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/NmW6Nf2ipgPBZW4C.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/NmW6Nf2ipgPBZW4C.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/NmW6Nf2ipgPBZW4C.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/NmW6Nf2ipgPBZW4C.full -->

## 10. Step 10
- Push the needle back up through the backside of the fabric, directly next to the original knot
- Work the needle up through one of the two remaining holes without thread.
- Pull the thread taut.
![Step 10 Image 294656](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/YvpnlYHshIsMqaxM.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/YvpnlYHshIsMqaxM.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/YvpnlYHshIsMqaxM.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/YvpnlYHshIsMqaxM.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/YvpnlYHshIsMqaxM.full -->
![Step 10 Image 294657](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ZZQMDQiaPvhHeyJH.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ZZQMDQiaPvhHeyJH.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ZZQMDQiaPvhHeyJH.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ZZQMDQiaPvhHeyJH.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ZZQMDQiaPvhHeyJH.full -->
![Step 10 Image 294658](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/2MWZQfNiTx5Ob4Bt.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/2MWZQfNiTx5Ob4Bt.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/2MWZQfNiTx5Ob4Bt.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/2MWZQfNiTx5Ob4Bt.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/2MWZQfNiTx5Ob4Bt.full -->

## 11. Step 11
- Go back through the last remaining empty hole on the button.
  - Be sure to go through only the button, not the fabric.
- Go back down through the fabric, as close as possible to the other two threads.
- Pull the thread taut.
![Step 11 Image 294659](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/AsViSJqZcqtW6BGR.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/AsViSJqZcqtW6BGR.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/AsViSJqZcqtW6BGR.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/AsViSJqZcqtW6BGR.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/AsViSJqZcqtW6BGR.full -->
![Step 11 Image 294660](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/cdDemu3mGXyCMbme.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/cdDemu3mGXyCMbme.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/cdDemu3mGXyCMbme.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/cdDemu3mGXyCMbme.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/cdDemu3mGXyCMbme.full -->
![Step 11 Image 294661](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/CcwFcVyDTw6vrW3C.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/CcwFcVyDTw6vrW3C.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/CcwFcVyDTw6vrW3C.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/CcwFcVyDTw6vrW3C.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/CcwFcVyDTw6vrW3C.full -->

## 12. Step 12
- Drive the needle back up through the underside of the fabric and into the first hole that you threaded.
- Pull the thread taut.
![Step 12 Image 294662](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/bWGFpbtQPiqNQ2tf.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/bWGFpbtQPiqNQ2tf.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/bWGFpbtQPiqNQ2tf.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/bWGFpbtQPiqNQ2tf.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/bWGFpbtQPiqNQ2tf.full -->
![Step 12 Image 294663](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/kVqLNgfBcKNlntZi.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/kVqLNgfBcKNlntZi.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/kVqLNgfBcKNlntZi.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/kVqLNgfBcKNlntZi.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/kVqLNgfBcKNlntZi.full -->
![Step 12 Image 294664](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/X3EFWXOMWOUHiLvN.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/X3EFWXOMWOUHiLvN.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/X3EFWXOMWOUHiLvN.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/X3EFWXOMWOUHiLvN.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/X3EFWXOMWOUHiLvN.full -->

## 13. Step 13
- Go back down through the second hole, directly across from the hole you just came up through.
- Pull taut.
![Step 13 Image 294665](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/WtXZQAVNAOKyYCk4.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/WtXZQAVNAOKyYCk4.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/WtXZQAVNAOKyYCk4.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/WtXZQAVNAOKyYCk4.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/WtXZQAVNAOKyYCk4.full -->
![Step 13 Image 294666](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/WrSTXO3K3JaJQaDE.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/WrSTXO3K3JaJQaDE.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/WrSTXO3K3JaJQaDE.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/WrSTXO3K3JaJQaDE.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/WrSTXO3K3JaJQaDE.full -->

## 14. Step 14
- Push the needle up through the third hole again.
- Pull it taut.
- Push the needle down through the fourth hole and pull it taut.
> **Note:** Repeat steps 12-14 of this guide one more time, then proceed.
![Step 14 Image 294667](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/2YaZfRplfEKEUoib.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/2YaZfRplfEKEUoib.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/2YaZfRplfEKEUoib.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/2YaZfRplfEKEUoib.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/2YaZfRplfEKEUoib.full -->
![Step 14 Image 294668](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/KVoTRKOHViNe5cTd.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/KVoTRKOHViNe5cTd.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/KVoTRKOHViNe5cTd.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/KVoTRKOHViNe5cTd.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/KVoTRKOHViNe5cTd.full -->
![Step 14 Image 294669](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/uMfpf3FRla23LT5A.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/uMfpf3FRla23LT5A.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/uMfpf3FRla23LT5A.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/uMfpf3FRla23LT5A.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/uMfpf3FRla23LT5A.full -->

## 15. Step 15
> **Note:** You have sewn in the button. Now you need a knot to keep the button in place.
- Push the needle through the loops of thread on the underside of the fabric. Be careful not to catch the fabric.
![Step 15 Image 294670](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/wrMFEwUARRqECwFm.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/wrMFEwUARRqECwFm.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/wrMFEwUARRqECwFm.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/wrMFEwUARRqECwFm.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/wrMFEwUARRqECwFm.full -->
![Step 15 Image 294671](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ZOouAHewFBcPW3ej.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ZOouAHewFBcPW3ej.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ZOouAHewFBcPW3ej.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ZOouAHewFBcPW3ej.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ZOouAHewFBcPW3ej.full -->
![Step 15 Image 294672](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ZXTHInHGfNTVGAKB.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ZXTHInHGfNTVGAKB.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ZXTHInHGfNTVGAKB.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ZXTHInHGfNTVGAKB.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ZXTHInHGfNTVGAKB.full -->

## 16. Step 16
- Leave some slack in the thread and draw the needle through the loop created by the slack.
- Pull the thread taut, forming a knot.
- Repeat steps 15 and 16 one more time to add a second knot.
![Step 16 Image 294673](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/VFL3oQmjOYRUaWVu.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/VFL3oQmjOYRUaWVu.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/VFL3oQmjOYRUaWVu.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/VFL3oQmjOYRUaWVu.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/VFL3oQmjOYRUaWVu.full -->
![Step 16 Image 294674](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/sUgg6qETMXUpC5sI.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/sUgg6qETMXUpC5sI.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/sUgg6qETMXUpC5sI.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/sUgg6qETMXUpC5sI.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/sUgg6qETMXUpC5sI.full -->

## 17. Step 17
- Clip the excess thread off.
- Check your button for stability.
![Step 17 Image 294675](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/yByEIehM24YhARkL.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/yByEIehM24YhARkL.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/yByEIehM24YhARkL.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/yByEIehM24YhARkL.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/yByEIehM24YhARkL.full -->
![Step 17 Image 294676](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/DuSuQsxAsTBaOaj5.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/DuSuQsxAsTBaOaj5.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/DuSuQsxAsTBaOaj5.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/DuSuQsxAsTBaOaj5.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/DuSuQsxAsTBaOaj5.full -->

guides.title: How to Clean Up Solder Pads
guides.raw_content:
# How to Clean Up Solder Pads

In this guide, I am going to show you how to clean up solder pads on a logic board. I'll be working on a Chinese A13 Allwinner tablet. I'm cleaning the solder pads for the battery, so I can solder a new battery onto the logic board.

## 1. Equipment and supplies
> **Note:** The materials needed for this are a soldering iron, soldering paste and desoldering wire, also known as a wick.
> **Note:** The soldering paste helps the solder flow into the wick better. If you don't have soldering paste, you can get similar results with flux.
![Step 1 Image 307579](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/HIaJuQDLS3TqmoQM.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/HIaJuQDLS3TqmoQM.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/HIaJuQDLS3TqmoQM.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/HIaJuQDLS3TqmoQM.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/HIaJuQDLS3TqmoQM.full -->

## 2. Prep the area
> **Note:** There are many types of soldering paste—many of which are in a syringe-like tube, which makes it easy to get the paste in the exact spot it needs to be.
> **Note:** I personally use a plastic opening tool to scoop a little out and apply it gently on the spot I will be working on.
> **Note:** If you don't have soldering paste, apply some flux to the spot you're working on.
![Step 2 Image 307582](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/L5rWh1HORALWhNjf.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/L5rWh1HORALWhNjf.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/L5rWh1HORALWhNjf.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/L5rWh1HORALWhNjf.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/L5rWh1HORALWhNjf.full -->

## 3. Step 3
- The location I will be de-soldering is right above the SPK location in the photo.
> ⚠️ **Caution:** ***If you're de-soldering battery connections, be very careful not to short the contacts with your soldering iron or the solder wick. *** If possible, cut the battery wires first, one at a time. This removes the chance of accidentally shorting the battery.
![Step 3 Image 308721](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/VpCLxeSPQiwFbKVn.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/VpCLxeSPQiwFbKVn.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/VpCLxeSPQiwFbKVn.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/VpCLxeSPQiwFbKVn.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/VpCLxeSPQiwFbKVn.full -->

## 4. Heat the solder joint
- Place the de-soldering wick on the solder joint and put the tip of the soldering iron on it so the wick can heat up and absorb the old solder.
- ***Lift the wick and the [product|IF145-495|soldering iron|new_window=true] up from the logic board at the same time.*** Failure to do so can cause the leftover solder to harden and solder the wick to the logic board and you could easily pull a logic board pad off.
> ⚠️ **Caution:** Please remember that logic board components are very fragile and excessive heat can destroy these components.
![Step 4 Image 307583](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/u6yupmSJnFqShxPy.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/u6yupmSJnFqShxPy.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/u6yupmSJnFqShxPy.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/u6yupmSJnFqShxPy.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/u6yupmSJnFqShxPy.full -->
![Step 4 Image 307587](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/Rg4MBVth5VuchmUr.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/Rg4MBVth5VuchmUr.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/Rg4MBVth5VuchmUr.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/Rg4MBVth5VuchmUr.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/Rg4MBVth5VuchmUr.full -->

## 5. Step 5
- What’s left over is clean points on the solder board, ready for fresh solder.
![Step 5 Image 308720](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/tsxeL1kyHmGP1ZTO.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/tsxeL1kyHmGP1ZTO.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/tsxeL1kyHmGP1ZTO.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/tsxeL1kyHmGP1ZTO.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/tsxeL1kyHmGP1ZTO.full -->

## Conclusion

For more soldering guides and tips, check out [link|https://www.ifixit.com/Device/Soldering|this page|new_window=true].

guides.title: How to Use a Needle Threader
guides.raw_content:
# How to Use a Needle Threader

Having trouble getting the thread though the eensy-weensy eye of that needle? Not to worry—a needle threader makes the task simple.



[link|https://www.ifixit.com/collaborations/patagonia|Return to the Patagonia Care & Repair homepage|new_window=true].

## 1. Step 1
- Take the needle threader in one hand, and the needle in your other hand.
- Insert the wire loop on the needle threader through the eye of the needle.
![Step 1 Image 309845](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/1idE2DgEm1tB4BTT.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/1idE2DgEm1tB4BTT.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/1idE2DgEm1tB4BTT.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/1idE2DgEm1tB4BTT.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/1idE2DgEm1tB4BTT.full -->
![Step 1 Image 309843](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/4eLFCtc1cJlU2TEa.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/4eLFCtc1cJlU2TEa.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/4eLFCtc1cJlU2TEa.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/4eLFCtc1cJlU2TEa.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/4eLFCtc1cJlU2TEa.full -->

## 2. Step 2
- Hold both the needle threader and needle in one hand, while keeping the loop of wire on the needle threader through the eye of the needle.
- Insert your thread through the loop of wire on the needle threader.
- Pull the thread through the loop so that you have a tail of least a few inches in length.
![Step 2 Image 309842](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/HUrUopOyXAPeLa6P.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/HUrUopOyXAPeLa6P.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/HUrUopOyXAPeLa6P.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/HUrUopOyXAPeLa6P.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/HUrUopOyXAPeLa6P.full -->
![Step 2 Image 309847](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/46Y65n4XS3TmMAaC.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/46Y65n4XS3TmMAaC.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/46Y65n4XS3TmMAaC.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/46Y65n4XS3TmMAaC.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/46Y65n4XS3TmMAaC.full -->
![Step 2 Image 309840](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/PhPLkgNDQQtMUoRF.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/PhPLkgNDQQtMUoRF.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/PhPLkgNDQQtMUoRF.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/PhPLkgNDQQtMUoRF.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/PhPLkgNDQQtMUoRF.full -->

## 3. Step 3
- Fold the tail over to meet the other thread.
- Hold both lengths of thread together.
![Step 3 Image 309839](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/NkCee2YdYQs2yTxK.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/NkCee2YdYQs2yTxK.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/NkCee2YdYQs2yTxK.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/NkCee2YdYQs2yTxK.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/NkCee2YdYQs2yTxK.full -->
![Step 3 Image 309838](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ueEYBU6WBOJDPeZD.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ueEYBU6WBOJDPeZD.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ueEYBU6WBOJDPeZD.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ueEYBU6WBOJDPeZD.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ueEYBU6WBOJDPeZD.full -->

## 4. Step 4
- While holding both threads, pull the wire loop of the needle threader out of the eye of the needle.
- Once the wire loop is out of the eye, release the tail end of the thread.
- Pull the needle threader off the thread. This will bring the tail end through.
![Step 4 Image 309837](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/K5nKhHFoLyD2pD6X.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/K5nKhHFoLyD2pD6X.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/K5nKhHFoLyD2pD6X.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/K5nKhHFoLyD2pD6X.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/K5nKhHFoLyD2pD6X.full -->
![Step 4 Image 309850](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ghoBUMMWjwrNwckE.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ghoBUMMWjwrNwckE.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ghoBUMMWjwrNwckE.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ghoBUMMWjwrNwckE.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ghoBUMMWjwrNwckE.full -->
![Step 4 Image 309835](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ED2b6PIIZjuSGyVC.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ED2b6PIIZjuSGyVC.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ED2b6PIIZjuSGyVC.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ED2b6PIIZjuSGyVC.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ED2b6PIIZjuSGyVC.full -->

## 5. Step 5
- Pull the tail end of the thread until both threads are equal in length.
- Holding both lengths of thread together, tie a knot near the end and pull it tight.
> **Note:** This will trap the needle in the loop of thread and allow you to sew with doubled thread. If you prefer to sew with a single thread, tie a knot in only one of the threads, not both.
![Step 5 Image 309852](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/G2oOXsU6anLUeYi6.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/G2oOXsU6anLUeYi6.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/G2oOXsU6anLUeYi6.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/G2oOXsU6anLUeYi6.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/G2oOXsU6anLUeYi6.full -->
![Step 5 Image 309833](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/rsGHobRoKICGnowN.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/rsGHobRoKICGnowN.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/rsGHobRoKICGnowN.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/rsGHobRoKICGnowN.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/rsGHobRoKICGnowN.full -->
![Step 5 Image 309834](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/v3YHlAkkth2FAVGF.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/v3YHlAkkth2FAVGF.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/v3YHlAkkth2FAVGF.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/v3YHlAkkth2FAVGF.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/v3YHlAkkth2FAVGF.full -->

guides.title: How to Sew a Whip Stitch
guides.raw_content:
# How to Sew a Whip Stitch

A whip stitch is an easy way to sew two pieces of fabric together. You can use this stitch whether the edges of the two pieces of material line up or not. If they do line up, the stitch will loop around the outside edge of the material.

## 1. Step 1
- Align the two pieces of material you will be stitching together.
- [guide|21024|Thread your needle] and tie a knot in the end of the thread.
> **Note:** We'll use a bright-colored thread for better contrast, but you may want to select a thread that matches the color of your fabric.
- Drive the needle into the bottom layer of material from the back side.
![Step 1 Image 309873](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/2KgBkuPgGpBtaeIs.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/2KgBkuPgGpBtaeIs.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/2KgBkuPgGpBtaeIs.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/2KgBkuPgGpBtaeIs.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/2KgBkuPgGpBtaeIs.full -->
![Step 1 Image 309874](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/4IrnOJN4slvwb3px.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/4IrnOJN4slvwb3px.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/4IrnOJN4slvwb3px.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/4IrnOJN4slvwb3px.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/4IrnOJN4slvwb3px.full -->

## 2. Step 2
- Pull the needle through the bottom layer of material.
- Pull the thread taut.
![Step 2 Image 309875](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/TQSJF5UKyFHTDA3G.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/TQSJF5UKyFHTDA3G.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/TQSJF5UKyFHTDA3G.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/TQSJF5UKyFHTDA3G.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/TQSJF5UKyFHTDA3G.full -->
![Step 2 Image 309877](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/KEWsZGF4SerJvOGm.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/KEWsZGF4SerJvOGm.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/KEWsZGF4SerJvOGm.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/KEWsZGF4SerJvOGm.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/KEWsZGF4SerJvOGm.full -->
![Step 2 Image 309867](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/DvqikjXT2fChCrA5.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/DvqikjXT2fChCrA5.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/DvqikjXT2fChCrA5.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/DvqikjXT2fChCrA5.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/DvqikjXT2fChCrA5.full -->

## 3. Step 3
- Drive the needle down through the top and bottom layers of fabric, close to where the needle came up.
> **Note:** The distance between where the needle comes up and goes down will be your stitch length. The smaller the stitch length, the more stitches required—and the stronger the seam.
- Pull the thread taut on the backside of the bottom material.
![Step 3 Image 309866](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/CiqRhf25JvOM6Z2A.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/CiqRhf25JvOM6Z2A.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/CiqRhf25JvOM6Z2A.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/CiqRhf25JvOM6Z2A.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/CiqRhf25JvOM6Z2A.full -->
![Step 3 Image 309878](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/eTfDRJ6ZMAvEYKf6.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/eTfDRJ6ZMAvEYKf6.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/eTfDRJ6ZMAvEYKf6.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/eTfDRJ6ZMAvEYKf6.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/eTfDRJ6ZMAvEYKf6.full -->
![Step 3 Image 309863](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/xkdxVeXioN4Gicia.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/xkdxVeXioN4Gicia.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/xkdxVeXioN4Gicia.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/xkdxVeXioN4Gicia.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/xkdxVeXioN4Gicia.full -->

## 4. Step 4
- Continue bringing the needle up and down through both layers of fabric, as in steps 2 and 3 of this guide, working your way around the material.
> **Note:** If you are using this stitch as a repair where a stitch already exists, be sure to overlap the existing stitching by several stitches to help prevent it from unraveling.
![Step 4 Image 309879](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/QEJfbgdCxnIS2BoL.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/QEJfbgdCxnIS2BoL.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/QEJfbgdCxnIS2BoL.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/QEJfbgdCxnIS2BoL.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/QEJfbgdCxnIS2BoL.full -->
![Step 4 Image 309860](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/4VSt3vSSyxwRS5SG.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/4VSt3vSSyxwRS5SG.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/4VSt3vSSyxwRS5SG.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/4VSt3vSSyxwRS5SG.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/4VSt3vSSyxwRS5SG.full -->

## 5. Step 5
- For the final stitch, come up from the back of the bottom material once again.
- Draw the needle between the two layers of material through the stitch closest to where the needle came up.
![Step 5 Image 309883](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/bsgwlogOHYL3aauU.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/bsgwlogOHYL3aauU.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/bsgwlogOHYL3aauU.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/bsgwlogOHYL3aauU.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/bsgwlogOHYL3aauU.full -->
![Step 5 Image 309882](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/iJvtA5hGuFWi6jHd.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/iJvtA5hGuFWi6jHd.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/iJvtA5hGuFWi6jHd.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/iJvtA5hGuFWi6jHd.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/iJvtA5hGuFWi6jHd.full -->

## 6. Step 6
- Slowly start to pull the thread taut. As you pull, you will see a loop form.
- Draw the needle through the loop.
- Pull the thread taut, forming a knot.
- Repeat the process of driving the needle up from behind, drawing it through the stitch, and pulling it through the loop as described in steps 5 and 6 of this guide one more time.
![Step 6 Image 309858](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/qgVLXtf3MFyPkiWu.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/qgVLXtf3MFyPkiWu.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/qgVLXtf3MFyPkiWu.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/qgVLXtf3MFyPkiWu.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/qgVLXtf3MFyPkiWu.full -->
![Step 6 Image 309857](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/dN52koE2vRNWJty4.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/dN52koE2vRNWJty4.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/dN52koE2vRNWJty4.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/dN52koE2vRNWJty4.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/dN52koE2vRNWJty4.full -->
![Step 6 Image 309855](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ptQg5OwJgkZG51BH.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ptQg5OwJgkZG51BH.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ptQg5OwJgkZG51BH.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ptQg5OwJgkZG51BH.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/ptQg5OwJgkZG51BH.full -->

## 7. Step 7
- Ensure that the stitches are tight.
- Cut any remaining thread, and admire your handiwork.
![Step 7 Image 309885](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/pDW4RpOwtSOg3ROK.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/pDW4RpOwtSOg3ROK.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/pDW4RpOwtSOg3ROK.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/pDW4RpOwtSOg3ROK.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/pDW4RpOwtSOg3ROK.full -->

guides.title: Sew a Ladder Stitch
guides.raw_content:
# Sew a Ladder Stitch

A ladder stitch, or closure stitch, is a sewing technique that allows you to close a tear without leaving the stitching visible.

The trick is to make the stitches as small and as even as possible. This technique works for repairing almost any type of tear.

## 1. Step 1
- [guide|21024|Thread your needle] and tie a knot in the end.
> **Note:** We're using contrasting thread for visibility, but when it comes time for your repair, you'll want to use matching thread.
- Drive the needle from the back of the material, just before where the tear starts.
- Pull the thread taut.
![Step 1 Image 309913](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/MAo1aQrFmscsGNaX.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/MAo1aQrFmscsGNaX.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/MAo1aQrFmscsGNaX.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/MAo1aQrFmscsGNaX.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/MAo1aQrFmscsGNaX.full -->
![Step 1 Image 309901](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/iZ4TBjt2KOBnxoCm.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/iZ4TBjt2KOBnxoCm.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/iZ4TBjt2KOBnxoCm.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/iZ4TBjt2KOBnxoCm.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/iZ4TBjt2KOBnxoCm.full -->
![Step 1 Image 309899](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/3kbRlLUSPnKiGMiC.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/3kbRlLUSPnKiGMiC.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/3kbRlLUSPnKiGMiC.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/3kbRlLUSPnKiGMiC.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/3kbRlLUSPnKiGMiC.full -->

## 2. Step 2
- Take a small stitch, going in and out of the material, on one side of the tear only.
- Pull the thread taut.
![Step 2 Image 309904](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/PWH1uPaxmfidoTuE.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/PWH1uPaxmfidoTuE.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/PWH1uPaxmfidoTuE.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/PWH1uPaxmfidoTuE.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/PWH1uPaxmfidoTuE.full -->
![Step 2 Image 309907](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/u5cUAjLBjNNylG3n.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/u5cUAjLBjNNylG3n.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/u5cUAjLBjNNylG3n.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/u5cUAjLBjNNylG3n.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/u5cUAjLBjNNylG3n.full -->

## 3. Step 3
- Take a small stitch, going in and out of the material, on the other side of the tear, directly opposite of the stitch you just took.
- Pull the thread taut. This should cinch the material together.
> **Note:** If your material bunches, try taking smaller stitches, while ensuring that you line up the stitches on either side of the material.
![Step 3 Image 309894](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/5QOSonyG2QW3prCF.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/5QOSonyG2QW3prCF.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/5QOSonyG2QW3prCF.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/5QOSonyG2QW3prCF.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/5QOSonyG2QW3prCF.full -->
![Step 3 Image 309908](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/WFTQp2bZP6PcMwnD.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/WFTQp2bZP6PcMwnD.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/WFTQp2bZP6PcMwnD.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/WFTQp2bZP6PcMwnD.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/WFTQp2bZP6PcMwnD.full -->

## 4. Step 4
- Continue stitching, switching from side to side as described in step 2 and 3 of this guide, pulling the thread taut after each stitch.
- Stitch until you come to the end of the tear.
![Step 4 Image 309909](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/66Jw3NYPIOVGG6ab.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/66Jw3NYPIOVGG6ab.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/66Jw3NYPIOVGG6ab.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/66Jw3NYPIOVGG6ab.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/66Jw3NYPIOVGG6ab.full -->
![Step 4 Image 309897](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/H5avRYCUFZDbRMMW.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/H5avRYCUFZDbRMMW.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/H5avRYCUFZDbRMMW.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/H5avRYCUFZDbRMMW.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/H5avRYCUFZDbRMMW.full -->

## 5. Step 5
- One the last stitch, drive the needle through both sides of the fabric, taking as small of a stitch as possible.
- Slowly pull the thread. As you pull, a loop will form. Draw the needle through this loop, and pull the thread taut.
- Repeat this step, taking a tiny stitch, drawing the needle through the loop, and pulling taut.
- Ensure that the stitches are tight, and cut any excess threads.
![Step 5 Image 309910](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/asNtQUgCCrQWJ1Jy.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/asNtQUgCCrQWJ1Jy.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/asNtQUgCCrQWJ1Jy.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/asNtQUgCCrQWJ1Jy.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/asNtQUgCCrQWJ1Jy.full -->
![Step 5 Image 309911](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/XObTJnGU4EwOWrLB.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/XObTJnGU4EwOWrLB.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/XObTJnGU4EwOWrLB.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/XObTJnGU4EwOWrLB.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/XObTJnGU4EwOWrLB.full -->
![Step 5 Image 309888](https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/gorlb5qQItSQSMgs.full)
<!-- Image URLs: thumbnail=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/gorlb5qQItSQSMgs.thumbnail, medium=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/gorlb5qQItSQSMgs.medium, large=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/gorlb5qQItSQSMgs.large, original=https://guide-images.cdn.ifixit.com/igi/gorlb5qQItSQSMgs.full -->
